2015 bottle pour at Hops & Pie, 3 oz. Deep reddish and light hazy appearance with a pinkish white head. Aroma of barnyard funk, toasted oak, raspberries, sour cherries, earth and light grains. Vintage 13 partagée avec les potes.Belle robe bien opaque. Dans mon verre, de la confiture de fruits bien sucrée, bien crémeuse. Les premières arômes me sont difficiles. Il faut dire que la bouteille est froide. Une importante cerise noire, macérée dans un sirop me monte au nez, ainsi que détranges arômes de plastique te de vernis. Cest très intense. Jai besoin de temps, elle aussi Laissons-nous le temps de nous apprivoiser. En nous réchauffant et en négociant de bonne foi, nous parvenons petit à petit à une entente. Le cerise sestompe tranquillement, le plastique a disparu (sans doute simplement dissout dans cette acidité peu discrète) et la framboise prend son envol. du pépin de framboise, bien plus que de la chair. Cest capiteux et très tannique, sans être vineux. Lamertume des pépins de fruits apporte une astringence cohérente avec le PH très bas de cette bière agressive. Longue en bouche, très pétillante, acide et sucrée, une 750ml se partage parfaitement entre 5 palais robustes.

2013 750mL bottle drunk 11/5/16.Large, pink-flecked head showing modest retention for style tops a clear, cranberry body.Big fruits in the nose, even after three years...Raspberry and cherry, of course, with the punchy, jammy character of young raspberry having disappeared. Funky, of course, though no big barnyard and no sulfur. Lots of fruity brett acids, black pepper and light lactic acid somewhat drying out and certainly balancing the fruit. None (or very little) of the strong band aid and no eather of older oude kriek vintages. So thats kind of a bummer. But its still authentic and highly enjoyable with glorious fruit aromas persisting strongly.Lots of fruit in the mouth with tight carbonation, moderate lactic acid and black pepper character helping to balance the sweet cherry notes. Soft, malty texture with tight carbonation and a bright raspberry and brett finish. Im not going to lie, I want a LOT more funk than this but its still very well-done.

4400th review! 750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 6/30/2015. Pours slightly hazy ruby red color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. :Light spotty lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of huge tart/juicy/jammy raspberry, sour cherry, cranberry, strawberry, lemon peel, hay, straw, pepper, leather, musty funk, oak, light red wine vinegar, and yeast earthiness. Fantastic aromas with awesome complexity and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, raspberry/cherries, oak, and light malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge tart/juicy/jammy raspberry, sour cherry, cranberry, strawberry, lemon peel, hay, straw, pepper, leather, musty funk, oak, light red wine vinegar, wheat, and yeast/oak earthiness. Good amount of fruity/acidic sourness and yeast/tannic oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of sour raspberry, cherry, cranberry, strawberry, lemon peel, hay, straw, pepper, leather, musty funk, oak, light red wine vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, raspberry/cherries, oak, and light malt flavors; with a great sour/tart/spiciness balance and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Good dryness from lactic acidity/tannic spiciness as well. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, acidic/tannic, and lightly grainy/creamy mouthfeel that is awesome. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 6%. Overall this is an incredible fruit lambic! All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, raspberry/cherries, oak, and light malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink for the high level of acidity. A really amazing offering all around.

Hommage 15 vintage

Pours a vibrant pink, crimson red color, with a small, fizzy white head, leaving back a bubbly lacing at the edge of the glass.

The fruits are quite apparent on the nose, surprisingly even more defined by cherry than raspberry, while both create a great blend among a funky tartness. A certain ripeness from the fruits introduces a moldy, leathery earth component, complimenting the stone qualities of the fruits, up to a jammy, sweet peak. Apart from this, the fruits create a fresh, almost unripe impression, highlighting the prickly raspberry stone pits among wet hay and crisp lemon peel.

Has a lively, yet soft carbonation to it, resulting in a refreshing but smooth mouthfeel, with a mineral quality during the beers finish, complimenting its tartness perfectly. 

Tastes of lemon peel, dusty, old malts together with wet hay, creating the foundation of this beer. Raspberry and cherry settle among this immediately, adding a rich fruitiness during the mid palate, perfectly blending into the beers lemon tartness during the finish. This lends a noteable sweetness to the otherwise pleasantly tart beer, sticking to its lambic roots, while adding an awesome complexity.

Its fruitiness is certainly a pleasant addition, while complimenting to the pungent tartness during the beers typical, teeth drying finish. A soothing stony mineral quality tames the prominent lemon in this, while highlighting a short, sweet peak from the fruits, adding pleasantly to the body of the beer.

A murky reddish amber Gueuze with a very thin off white head. In aroma, intense ground cherry, raspberry, Epsom salts, lactic acid, ketchup, interesting. In mouth, a nice dark cherries, lactic acid, raspberry, Epsom salts, complex and beautiful. Bottle at Ottawa Xmas gathering 2015.
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2016 Bottle shared at Grizzley?s. Cloudy pinkish red pour. Tart cherry aroma. Taste follows with raspberry jam flavor. Huge carbonation and tartness. Amazing, amazing stuff.

(750ml 2013 bottle @ Grote Dorst, Eizeringen, Nov 15 2015, split w/ phyllomedusa) Pours a lightly hazed light red-brown with a small dense lingering ring of whitish head, no lace. Aroma is so so very jammy, lovely raspberry and no small amount of sour cherry preserve given the proportions. A little caramel malt for body, fairly light lactic yogurt tang, bready hints, some oak and moderate wet barnyard funk laying over everything. Flavour is again jammy as anything Ive ever drank, raspberry and tart cherry with a touch of supporting caramel up front, and wet earthy Brett. Sweetness is balanced by a moderate level of lemon yoghurt acidity in the middle with oak and raspberry seeds. Finish is fairly dry, moderately sour and a bit wine-like with persistent cherry and tart raspberry, a little astringency from the oak and fruit, and barnyard still present to match. Very long fruity aftertaste. Medium bodied with a little more heft than your average lambic and soft but tingling effervescent carb. Wow. Hard to do justice to, this is just a sensational fruit lambic. Complex and nuanced and yet such a jammy, honest extraction of the fruit character as well. Massive flavour concentration, very inviting to keep drinking. Beats Framboos and LPK for me, high praise!

Loads and loads of raspberry funk...medium tartness...light cherry skin. Moving into yogurt, light cheese and oak through the mid-palate. Outstanding! Finishes with a great balance between the tart and the funk. Vinous notes creep into the backend...light malt presence gives the mouthfeel a moderate stickiness and light sweetness. Very impressed with this beer and would love to try again!!

Bottle of 75 cl at In De Verzekering Tegen De Grote Dorst. Traditional framboise with sour cherries added, reminding conceptually of Cantillons Rosé de Gambrinus, but with more emphasis on the raspberries. Thin, loose, off-white bubbly head, murky pinkish deep fuchsia colour with brownish hue. Aroma has a ton of fresh fruit, red raspberries of course, but the sour cherries are equally noticeable; lemon, celery, tomato juice almost like in a Bloody Mary, blue grape peel, old sherry, raspberry vinegar, wet wood. Very rich sour fruit flavour, a lot of red raspberry with a beautiful aromatic quality, very lightly sweet, paired with a deeper, more tangy sour cherry tartness and a ton of esters, tomato juice again, fruit yoghurt without the sugar, crisp and astringently acid, soapy wheat, complex sherryish wood finish with ongoing acidity and finely tingling carbo, cherry stone astringency, leather, extremely dry in the end. Expensive, but very recommended if you are into uncompromizing fruit lambics, a worthy tribute to the late Gaston Debelder indeed.

Taste has a nice balance between the medium sourness and the sweet fruitiness of the raspberries. Finish is a medium sour and slightly dry. Medium body and carbo. Nice.

Bottle 2013 vintage drank one year later. Pour a thick burgundy red with very low head. Aroma is fruity and nicely showcases raspberries, blackberries and cherries. Definitly funky, decent horseblanket presence. Menthol notes reminds me of old 3F lambics. Taste is rich raspberries and cherries. Intense sourness, mostly citric, is balanced by fruity sweetness. Full bodied and rather low carbonation which accentuates the richness of this fruit lambic. This is not your everyday fruit lambic, it is however wonderfully complex for a lambic this age.

Pours a rich ruby red color with a finger of pinkish gaseous foam. Nose is crazy potpourri, floral, spicy orchid, cherry, barrel funk, dusty wood. The palate comes across much more fruit forward than the nose with beautiful layers of round cherry pie, spicy raspberry lots of complex underlying funk. This really is a beautiful beer with so much going on with the mixture of fruit, funk and acidity. YUM!

UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 sip at dark lord day. Normally wouldnt rare with this small if a sample but dont know if Ill ever see this top 100 tick again. Tart fruit. Carbonated. Very drinkable and refreshing. Wish there was more to try. 

2015 DLD. Full pour of this. Thanks Mitch. Sour, cherry, berries, touch of funk. Low acid. Very good.
UPDATED: APR 30, 2014 Aroma of band aids at first. Barnyard poop really shows through. Taste is slightly tart but not overly powerful. Light and bubbly. Easy to drink.
Bootle thanks to dld07. Batch 2. Poured clear red with white head. Aroma straight from the barn with a background of berries. Light carb with med bod. Balanced light sour. Opened my eyes.

Bottle at redlight redlight. Tart berries on the nose with hints of vinous aromas. Pours a rich red color with little head. Very acidic and sour upfront followed by berries and tannins with a bright acidic dry finish. Amazing.

2007 vintage shared with Zach at the Grote Dorst. Unlabeled bottle. Pours an orangey raspberry jam color with very small white head and lightly rising prickly carbonation. Aroma is bold and remarkable: deep and mysterious raspberry jam, candied lemon, lemon zest, apricot, plum, slight musty cork, straw, slight minerality, Sour Patch Kids, red wine. Taste is gulpable raspberry jam, sour plum, Burgundy, and grape skins with slightly tannic and lemony finish. Just so good. "This is so fucking good," Zach says. "I think thats the best beer Ive ever had." I agree with his first assertion, and maybe even with his second.

bottleshare thanks to DexterFace. Tart nose with a lot of cherry and fruit. Murky red pour. Medium head that dies quickly. Flavor is initially tart with a very well balanced fruit component. Not sure its worth the crazy cost but very enjoyable.
Shelf turd. Pours a hazy deep red with big pink head. Big funky yeast aroma, barnyard, horse blanket, light fruity raspberry character. Huge sourness, acidic, lots of raspberry flavor. Damn yummy.
Bottle share thanks to DrewFace. Pours deep red. Aroma of tart fruit, cherries, raspberries, duh. Taste is the same, yummy fruit, tart, yummy.

750 ml bottle (batch 2) to stemmed lambic glass...all by myself. Normally Id never drink a bottle of something like this alone, but I was out of town and it was available for on-site consumption only, so I pulled the trigger. And damn, am I glad I did! Looks excellent for the style; a hazy cranberry red with very light pink head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells awesome! Tart and funky with notes of raspberry and cherry. Tastes like it smells, but with more of a cherry presence. Pleasantly lively on the palate. This is fantastic beer!

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Small lively pink head that disappears right away. Hazy grapefruit colored headleass colored beer.
Aromas of wild yeast, raspberry, light cherry, wood, light fruity tar that points in the direction of Lambiek ish rubber.
Subliminally balanced!
Flavours of lovely raspberry, incredibilly balanced tart/sour tone, very nice woody tones... This is so intense! This is somethin like no other Fruit Lambic has achieved while Oudbeitje and LP Kriek came close!
Aftertaste is a mix of raspberry tarty wood ish yeasty love!
Medium to low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium to full bodied and a dry tarty texture.
This is incredible!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Delar en flaska med Hans och Johan W på Bierhuske. Härlig stämning. Elegant upphälld och presenterad. Rubinröd. Härliga cocktailkörsbär och bigarrå. Angenäm funk och bajsdoft. Läskande och lagom syra. Lite hallon och körsbär i bra balans. Behaglig syra. Kul kryss.

Poured a nice pinkish red color with aromas of tart cherries, tart raspberries and some light funk. Flavors are the same restart jammy fruit and light funk with some oak on the back end. Thanks Cleg for the share.

Bouteille de 750 ml, édition 2013, merci beaucoup à Julien. Arômes explosifs de framboises fraîches. Belles notes rustiques de brettanomyces. Robe rouge et trouble, effervescence moyenne et légère dentelle rosée. En bouche, on retrouve un véritable champ de framboises, incluant un côté végétal rappelant les feuilles de la plante! Très belles notes rustiques provenant du lambic et belle acidité portant surtout sur le lactique et le citrique. Finale sèche et moyennement acide pour le style. Vraiment un excellent lambic aux fruits.

Bottle at home with friends, courtesy of Aaron. Huge thanks for this man!! Pour is bright pink with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Huge jammy, raspberry, blueberries, fruit peel, sweet tarts, funky, light urine, lemons, and hay in the aroma. Taste is sweet fruits, raspberry, cinnamon, graham crackers, blackberry, fruit peel, spice, cherry pie, and vanilla with a lightly sour finish. Slick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Such a sweet fruit and jam forward beer, yet balanced with spice - almost pie-like - absolutely delicious.
At Stephens House with Stephen, Aaron, and Dave. Pours strawberry red. Aroma is strawberry sour, acidic. Taste is jammy strawberry, sour tange, sweet tart.

2007 vintage thanks to travlr at the RBBSG II. Pours orangish red with tiny off-white head. The smell is over-ripe raspberries with lots of sweetness. The taste again the over-ripe raspberries, tart, citrus, vinegar coming later with a dry and crisp finish. Light body with crisp carbonation. Really special - I now understand the interest in this beer.

75cl bottle. Shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear reddish beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: raspberries, fruity in general, sour, funky, wood, cherries are there as well.
TASTE: funky, like most 3F brews, little dry, fruity, raspberries come through lot, cherries are again noticeable.
Amazing brew, will probably age quite well!

750 ml. bottle. Thanks Kirk! Pours red with a brown tinge. Has a small pinkish head. Aroma of tart fruit, berries, and funk. Taste is tart raspberries, sour cherries, and funk. Delicious is an understatement.

pink head disappears fast. scarlet red colour slight murky. aroma of raspberry with hint of sulphur. taste is raspberry, cherry and lemonjuice like sourness. but very well balanced. medium body and carbonation. good stuff!  bottle 75 cl / batch 2

Bottle shared by Brad at RBWG 2014, thanks! Pours a hazy earthy red with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a light tart raspberry note with a huge earthy/barnyard funk note. Flavor is more acidic but still has raspberries coming through with funk throughout.

Bottled. Pours deep amber with small off-white head. Aroma of sour cherries, wood and barnyard. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and flat carb. A nice lambic indeed.

RBWG14 Trip Rating #67. Bottle shared by Ygtbsm94 at the Friday Night Downtown Inn Bottle Share. Pours a hazy red color with a large creamy off-white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of tart fruits, cherries, berries, mild funk. The taste is tart cherries, berries, mild funk. Medium bodied, overall fairly bright.
Ruby red pour. Nose is big herbal tea, some sour berries. Taste is very tart berries, very fruity, some funk. Light bodied. One of the best lambics Ive had.

Unbelievable stuff, thanks to David for hunting it down. Very punchlike beer, excellent raspberry flavor bursting throughout, aroma is juicy fruit, but never artificial, light cherry sweetness. The only problem I can find is that theres a weird balance on the tartness: in the mouth its perhaps a touch less lactic than Id like, but after swallowing it leaves a lingering burn. I still got through my 12 oz with total glee, but it keeps it from being a perfect fruitbic.
Bottle at RBWG, courtesy of someone. Pours a amber color with white head. Sour, tart cherry, funky flavors.

Poured cherry reddish brown with a disappearing frothy pink head. Aroma of sour sweet cherries. Medium body, flavour of vinegary cherry with a hint of raspberry and soft malt. Dry, dour lingering finish.

Tonight just seemed like the right time to open up the last bottle of the 2007 vintage...before I was tempted with some of the crazy trade offers. Slightly mahogany dark grapefruit with a off white head with a rose shading. Smells a bit musty, earthy raspberries, cherry, carbonation, some blanket, light acidity, oak, funk; every time you take a sniff there seems to a different combination of funk and fruit. Although the raspberries have faded they are still present and I like that the sweetness has given way to more funk and sourness (but no enamel peeling acidity). Moderate+ carbonation, dry, funky body, somewhat fruity ending but more dry oak and funk. Good lord this is delicious - so happy to be drinking it but so sad its my last bottle. O well.

(Bottle, 0.75 l - bottled 14/0202007, at Pikkulintu, 20140111) The beer poured ruby red and clear. Its head was small and almost white. Aroma had raspberries, cherries, sourness and cherry stones. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were raspberries, sourness, tartness, cherries, cinnamon and low bitterness. Aftertaste had raspberries, tartness and sourness. A very nice blend of raspberries and cherries in lambic

Bottle, courtesy of kermis. 2013 batch. Pours an unclear, pinkish beer with a thin, light pink head on top. Aroma of raspberries, guided by massive funk notes, Bretty touches, oak and other red fruityness. Awesome, strong aroma, reaches you while the glass is still on the table. Flavor is sour, tart raspberries, big red fruits and even a sweet, oaky touch in the finish. Quite a juicy mouthfeel, light carbo. Very nice fruit lambic!

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2015 Bottle courtesy of Kermis. Poured a hazy reddish amber with a broken off white head. The aroma is yeast acid citrus red berry fruit. The flavour is light acidic sour leading to an acid weak vinegar yeast palate. Light bodied with soft carbonation and a long soft light sour finish.

Big thanks to Kermis. Deep ruby with a pink fizzy, somewhat lasting lacy, head. Smells sweet and sour raspberries with a hint of the cherry sweetness with a bit of vinegar. Medium frothy oily body. Tastes of sweet berry with a hint of sourness in the background and finishes dry slightly sour. Lingering sweetness. Cant tell there is alcohol here.

2nd batch. Dark red colour, some white foam, disappears quickly. Medium carbonation. Very complex aroma of framboos and sour cherry. Some sweetness with a complex sour and dry aftertaste. Some notes of almonds. Very good beer!

750ml bottle, 1st batch. Original review 11-09-2010.

Pours dark ruby red (this was the last of the bottle), off-white head, some spotty lacing along the side of the glass, and a medium ring around the glass and some bubbles here and there on top of the glass with some wisps. Nose is sour cherries, oak, funk. Just wonderful to sniff over and over. Not overly complex but it gets straight to the point of awesomeness. The funk, oak, and cherries are wonderful. Flavor is raspberries, cherries, oak, funk, sour/tart notes. A little bit of each of these characteristics meld together to create one helluva blend. I get a lot of sour cherries, raspberries, and oak. Light body, crisp, fizzy carbonation, dry finish.

Welp, color me impressed. This went beyond my expectations and is right up there with any other lambic Ive had in the past. Yet another winner from 3F. Awesome.

Batch #2, bottled 6/26/2013. Deep, intense red hue yields fizzy pink-white bubbles that fade quickly. 

Dark, freshly crushed raspberry aroma atop the distinct smell of a 3F fruited lambic. Distinctive; unique. Is it wrong to label this their "house yeast strain"? 

Raspberries are fresh and, again, dark. Musty, cheesy, and an effervescent feel without actually being over-carbed. Feels almost gritty in the mouth. A totally different approach compared to the Cantillon raspberry lambics. 

Mild pucker at the end. Not particularly sour, just damn complex and tasty. Fruit will fade, but this should age like a champ otherwise. Need to get my hands on some b1.

Super fresh bottle shared at wedding party. Pours cloudy pink/purple with a fast dissipating white head. Aroma is red red fruits, raspberries, funk, manure, barnyard, cherries and vinegar. Beautiful fruity flavour. Light sour, light sweet. Perfect balance. Long fruity tart dry finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Amazing beer. Incredibly balanced. Armand really knows his lambics!

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2015 Bottle (2007) shared at 3 Fonteinen with gEUS and Dennoman. Pours hazy red brown with a small off white head. Aroma of tart raspberry, basement funk and light barnyard. Flavour is moderate sour, nicely soft. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
2015 vintage sampled fresh at release.  Fruit is super fresh in the nose, juicy raspberry and cherry showing through with a perfect balance.  Funk is very light at this stage but present.  Carbonation is good, light and pleasant.
Bottle share @ 3 Fonteinen. Pours red, with a white head. Sour aroma, with a hint of creosote. Smooth taste of sour raspberries.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2014 Bottle at 3 Fonteinen.shared with Dennoman and kermis. Pours hazy amber amber witha red hue. Aroma of funky raspberries, citrus and bit of grapefruit. Light body with nice light fruity sweetness and an acid sting that increaes in intensity towards the finish. lots of grapefruit peel in the taste next to sour cherries.
--- 
Had a fresh 2013 bottle as well in the meanwhile. Huge raspberry bomb, nice sourness perfectly balanced with the huge amount of forest fruit. Upped 0.4.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 20.04.2013, 0,75l bottle shared with ClubGonzo, ej & OleR @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas:
Fyldig fruktig lukt med preg av raude syrlige bær, eddik, maling, buljong, gras. Frisk lett syrlig fruktig smak med preg av eplecidereddik, sure raude bær, syregras, maling, sitron. Middels bitterhet som set litt. God, men langt frå å vere noke fantastiske greier.

Bottled: 2/14/07
A: Hazy Amber Hue, Passes Minimal Light, No Head, No Lacing

S: Sour Cherries, Tart Raspberries

T: Bitter Tomatoes, Tart Raspberries

M: No Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Sour

Overall, the sugary taste from the raspberries is long gone and now almost a tomato flavor...good but on the down slope.

Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... Sweet raspberry aroma, served in a champagne glass... Attractive magenta to dark red in color... Flavor is tart and sweet, more tart than sweet, refreshing and crisp, but the palate is what sets it apart... Sour, which stays long after sipping and is amazingly powerful... Great for a lambic, although it cost me 25 euro

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rusty reddish with no head. Aroma is raspberry, ripe strawberries, red currants, cherry, berry jam. Syrupy mouthfeel, tart and fruity on the finish. Taste is raspberries, cherry, vinaigrette, red currants.
UPDATED: DEC 3, 2015 Bottle at WTWBA. Golden orange pour with a white head. Monster sour and tart. Raspberry all over this. Some yeast. Some barnyard funk. Awesome.

And another fun bottle of beer offered by cpferris. Thanks once again. Bug jammy fruits. Potent raspberry seeded jammy raspberries. Fruit forward with a clean soft yogurt acidity. Easy drinkin. Some pleasant old must cellar and leather funk. Tight.

Bottle @ home 

Amazing fruit. The fruit aroma ust blew me away! Really amazing. A lot better than framboos.

Wow, not as wonderful as expected and wonder if it was cellared properly. Aroma brings too muc sulfur dioxide for me, like gas, with a little paint thinner and berry. Body is thicker, definitely bringing a big dryness. Flavor is quite tart and the berries are under the puckering tartness.
As expected, fantastic fruit lambic. Raspberries are strong, cherries are subtle. Great acidity and clean fruit. Surprisingly little funk for its age. 2007 bottle at Brouwers.

Pours an opaque rose/plum color with a thin white head. Aroma is musty/leathery with light raspberry, tart cherry, and vinous/funky notes...a bit of a beet note. Flavor follows suit...nice soft fruit notes and mild acidity...very well rounded. Mouthfeel is light and the finish is funky/leathery and tart fruit...dry. gorgeous beer...amazing.

2006 Vintage. Shared @Moeder Lambic, with the good RB people from Bergen, Norway. Shimmering orangey amber body. A layer of blonf bubbles on top. Initial aroma of dusty cobwebs and mouldy cellar. Then a strong, yet rounded scent of red berries funk and leather. Taste is utterly complex and balanced. Raspberry tart, lemon, unripe apples, grass, hay, dust, wood. All so well integrated. Smooth and mild mouthfeel. Light funk and rounded berry tartness in the ending. What a treat! [21.04.13]
Wonderful aroma jam jam jam, intense fruit, flat due to the bad cork! Hope to try it again! It's remarkable! Wonderful

2006 bottle @ Moeder Lambic, Brussels, courtesy of OleR and shared with OleR, Inbreak and ej. Legendary - cheers Ole Richard! :-D Pours a deep orange-brown body with a small white head. Aroma is deep spicy cellar notes, tart red fruity tones, cinnamon, hay, straw, hints of cherries and stable funk. So complex and yet subtle; this one sure smells promising. Taste is mellow dark malts and red fruits up front, then apple vinegar, stable funk and finally sharp lemony acidic tones, balsamic, acetic acid and red berries. Extremely complex, very tart and all round a splendid sour experience. A great sour from 3F.

Sampled around 2009.  INCREDIBLE.  Baskets of raspberries dipped in tart on the nose.  Sweeter raspberry on the flavor up front, sliding into wood, slight slight hints of vanilla, and funk.  But a tamed, polite funk, thats brilliant.  Nice long soured finish with hints of cherries blended well.  Craft at its finest!

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2013 75cl, Vintage 2013, exclusive brew, with raspberries and sour cherries, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex sour fruit brew, sour/fruity and slightly woody, very balanced, cloudy, small head, very good brew!, yet expensive!

750mL bottle at Grote Dorst, pours a cloudy ruby red with a pink tint and small pink-tinted beige head. Aroma of faded raspberries, some barnyard funk, and some dusty notes. Flavour is similar, bringing out potent notes of raspberries upfront, followed by barnyard funk, and some dustiness. I wouldve loved to try this fresh to have a point of comparison, as the raspberries are a little faded. Nevertheless, this is very complex, especially towards the end of the glass when the yeast kicks in more. Faded fruitiness and funky finish. Delicious stuff, but no where near 3 Fonteinen Framboos, which I cant help but use as a point of comparison.
Darkened orange. Aroma of over-ripe berries, hints of paintthinner, barnyard/dried hay and some woody notes. Taste is acidic, cellary, loads of berries and fruityness and bone-dry.

Bottle shared with Bruce at DHVL, 22/03/13.
Hazed crimson with a thin off pink head that retains well.
Nose is tarte cherries, vinous raspeberry, light fruit balsamics, wood, musty, grandads shed (refurbished!).
Taste comprises a ton of berry fruit goodness for a 7 year old lambic, rich raspberries backed up by cherries, sugars, balsams.
Medium bodied with spritzy carbonation, dry and rich fruit veins in the finish.
Top bollocks !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Bottle shared amongst BAs for one of the most ridiculous "lunchs" at the Torst opening!

Poured side by side by side with 2012 Blabaer and 2005 Fou foun.

Bottle poured a deep cherry red.  Nose was straight up raspberry jam.  A delicate balance between cheese funk, sweetness from the raspberry and tartness.  By far the most complex out of the three bottles we had.  Although well balanced flavors, all of the flavors were explosive.

Had at the Grote Dorst.  Pours hazy red with some brownish tints and a small pink head.  The nose is big raspberry, some brown sugar, some vinegar and lemons with funk and leather.  The taste is sweet with a balanced sour which eventually takes over.  Finally!  The mouthfeel is great and not overcarbonated unlike most of what I have had from 3 Font.  Its crisp and clean, body is light and the finish is long.  What a beer,
Poured from a 750 ml bottle, thanks to the Boise crew. Huge raspberry, lots of fruit puree-raspberry seeds, citrus, dusty. This is an amazing beer.

Bottle at Surt med Chris Anker. Pours mostly clear red with a small creamy pink head. The aroma is loaded with raspberries and other ripe berries like blackcurrant. Acidic notes in the background. The flavour is tart and has notes of grapefruit, cherry and loads of  raspberries. Fruity and tart berries in the finish. Only slight notes of barnyard and horse blanket. Great!

Bottle sample at a sour tasting at Noams office. Thanks DSG. Pours brown to pink orange with a beige to pink head, aroma of raspberries, amazing fruit sweetness, raspberry jam, great acidity, wood, lively and fresh, flavor is sour acidic with vinegar, plums wood, cork and wax, malt, zesty, full bodied, amazing brew

Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a tulip.  Tasted side by side with 2011 Framboos

Hommage pours a hazy crimson color with just a tiny wisp of an off white head.  

The raspberries are definitely noticeable in the nose, although the cherries are surprisingly prominent.  A strong tart aroma has a strong acetic vinegar component to it.  The acidity in the aroma seems to mostly overwhelm any funky wild elements that might be there.

Cherry is actually the stronger flavor coming through with my first sip.  Tart cherries, overripe cherry skin, sour raspberry, red grapes, oak, and balsamic vinegar all come together nicely.  The flavor has a gentle sweetness up front and then strikes a nice balance between fruity tartness and acetic vinegar.  There is a slightly off-putting plasticy note that comes through at the beginning of the sip, but other than that this is very enjoyable.

It has a nice, smooth, medium body for a lambic that is peppered with vinegar acidity.  The carbonation is on the lighter side of medium, and there is a slightly oaky and tannic finish.

This is clearly a well-crafted lambic.  I thought that raspberries would be the dominant fruit, but I was not disappointed that the cherries came through so strongly.  The plastic flavor in the flavor was enough for me to knock down the flavor and overall score, but everything else was solid.

750 ml bottle generously shared by cpferris.  Big thanks to Chad.  Pours a reddish amber with a small white head that settles to a ring and leaves some light lacing on the glass.  The aroma is lots of cherry, some raspberry, a light medicinal note, and funky oak.  The initial taste is sweet with some cherry and raspberry.  There is also lots of funky oak and a light medicinal note.  The finish is tart and funky. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Quite Tasty.

75cl bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. It pours a reddish almost copper colour with a small white/light tan head. Aroma is big on raspberries with funk, dust and oak. Taste is similarly fruity with raspberries, citrus peel, big funk and barnyard character. Dust and oak. Finishes dry in the palate. Good carbonation. Rounded and bold. Aged very well apparently.

At a tasting, thanks DSG, murky red to rusty orange, aroma of canned corn, ripe raspberries, rose petals and some woodiness, flavour of raspberries, wood and some vinegar, extremely strong sourness, scraping the throat a bit. Bold and very good.

pours clear red, white fast fading foam. smells fruity, hint of sourness. tastes like old red fruits, overripe, with a very very sour aftertaste. the most sour 3F i had so far ! yet its good, its not waawing me. yet im very happy to get to try this since i wanted it a long time. so damn lucky since again, i drank the last bottle they had ( sorry guys, its getting a bad habbit of mine ! ) 

thnx so much to 77ships for the tip where to get this !
nice sour raspberries aroma,red, hazy, light red foam,light sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, soft carbonation, sour raspberries finish.,

Opened in celebration of the 2012 Presidential Election, November 6 with my wonderful wife. Ive been hanging on to this bottle for roughly 3 years now. 2007 vintage is marked on the bottle. Cork comes out with a faint pop, pours a hazy golden cherry color with fine carbonation and a thin ring of head. Immediate aroma of acetic acid, funky cheese and sour cherry. The power of the aroma is nearly overwhelming. Barnyard and must is all over the nose. I cant believe how tart this is even with the age. The flavor is less intense than the aroma, with a dry sweet blend of cherry and dried grass. Flavor profile transitions from sweet to bitter cheese and yeasty biscuit, but incredibly complex. Undertones of old oak wood, wheat, peppercorn, rosemary and lemon zest. The finish is light and dry with a tingly carbonation sting on the palate. Overall a delightful drinking experience, the unbalanced aroma dinged it in my book, but the complexity gives it points. Well worth the wait, now well have to see what the bugs in this beer do to my bowels tomorrow morning...

My bottle, at our super tasting. Red pour with brown/copper hue and just a hair thick ring of white foam around the perimeter. Aroma is quite citric, lots of old raspberries, subtle cherry aromas, strong leathery funk. Taste is citric, tart, lots of berry tartness, the fruit comes off fresher than in the aroma. Palate is fairly dry despite the fruitiness, carbonation is rather low for the style. Very good, but not mindblowing.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2014 Bottle 750ml. Thx JulienHuxley. [9/3/9/4/18]
Corked with synthetic stuff. Pours hazy dark amber/orange with low off-white head (almost none). Lots of lacing. Aroma is of barnyard, funk, raspberries, fruits. Taste is sweetness, barnyard, funk, sourness, fruits (raspberries), acid. Overall: Very good, impressive. Surprisingly drinkable.[Following is for b2. Pours reddish with low pinky head. Aroma is of extreme raspberries, cherries, musty stuff. Taste is of extreme raspberries, nice sour cherries, musty stuff. Palate: Light-medium body. Soft but present carbonation. Overall: Just awesome. Just enough acidity. Not overdone. Quite complex. Outstanding. Usually when I have to censor my "notes", this means the beer is pretty darn good. Increasing score.]

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by JulienHuxley, thanks Julien & Pier-Luc! Murky orange/brown with reddish reflects, little to no head and some lacing. Aroma of fainted raspberries, cherries with tart and barnyard notes. Taste is of fresh raspberries (much more than aroma), cherries, other red fruits, tart and leather. Dry and astringent mouthfeel. One of the best fruited lambic Ive tasted so far, it lived up to my high expectations.

Ugly pour, very murky/dirty brownish, dark red.  Musty basement, earthy, funky, tart raspberry, and slight vinegar.  Good bit of raspberry left in this beer.  Its tart and seedy.  It worked well with the musty, earthy, funk and sourness.  Light carbonation and medium body.  Tried side by side with the 2011 framboos.  I prefered the aroma and flavor much more of this than the framboos.
Reddish coloured and unclear. Has a white head, mostly diminishing. Heavy acidic aroma and flavor. Raspberries, fermented raspberries. Astringent too.

Thanks to travlr for sharing the bottle! This would have been an extremely enjoyable beer to drink, except for the fact that fuckin bee flew into my ear while I was sipping my glass and made me spill a bunch of it! Serious funk on the nose. You can smell the sourness of the cherries. One finger head that leaves beautiful lacing. Tastes of straw, barnyard, and especially ripe red fruits. Taste lasts for days. Med-heavy carb, but with nice fine champagne-like bubbles. One hell of a beer!
Bottle. Frothy white fair mostly lasting head. Red amber colour. Powerfull raspberry aroma. Moderate bitter powerfull  raspberry flavor. long powerfull raspberry finish. Creamy palate. Wonderfull.

Bottle. Unclear dark amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, cherries, raspberries, tart and little almond. Flavour is malt, cherries, wood, raspberries, tart, barnyard, little sweet, light acid and a light acetone.

Bottle from Mikkeller Bar @ HenrikSoegaard tasting. Hazy orange with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, raspberry and wood. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 280912

Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich raspberries, cherries, brett, vinegar, wood, stable and malt. Superb beer. It feels like im in love with a beer. The aroma beats the scent of a woman.

Bottle @ DHVL. The pours deep hazy blood red with a medium reddish-white head that takes its time to settle. The nose is huge, bright raspberry jam. Soft and sweet, inviting. Notes of sugary bubblegum and fruit by the foot. Some woody acidity. I couldve sat at my table smelling this beer all day, though Id probably have looked like a bit of a pervert! The taste is hugely satisfying meaty raspberry and cherry fruits, light acidic wood. Some hints of green apple skin and twigs. The bodys very light and soft. This beers wonderfully drinkable. Overall, a phenomenal beer and excellent homage to Gaston Debelder. Worth every penny.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2012 Brought this to our mini Sunday whale tasting. Sampled side by side with the newest vintage of Framboos. Pours a murky purple, brownish red with little head formation on the pours. Its rather "dirty" looking in comparison to Framboos. Nose is surprisingly full of raspberry still, some very light vinegar, and slightly phenolic. Raspberries are prominent in the flavor as well, with a little bit of plastic peaking through as well. There is less funk than usual 3F of this vintage, but I am actually ok with it considering how much fruit is still showing. Moderate mouthfeel, heavy acidity, light carbonation, and a long finish. I think a lot of the slack this beer gets is unwarranted. It holds up very well to Framboos and despite having some plastic character to it, it doesnt detract much from the beer. Its an incredibly good lambic and one I look forward to having again.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2014 New rating (with a fresh bottle, original rating below)<br./>
18/I/14 - 75cl bottle @ RBBWG III, my place - BB: 6/2023, bottled: 26/VI/13 (supposedly this date is wrong)  (2014-xxx) Thanks to 77ships for sharing the bottle!
Note:  part of this bottle was used to make "beeramissu". It was a great opportunity to rerate the beer and drink it fresh instead of 5 years old. Wow, this is a lot better than the aged bottle we tried in 2012!
Pretty cloudy bright red to grapefruit pink beer, small aery pink head, dissipates immediately, non adhesive. Aroma: very funky, sour raspberry, bit lemony, you can smell the sourness. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: lots of sour raspberry first, very acidic, lemon juice, funky, little sweet touch, bit metallic. Aftertaste: very acidic, sour raspberries, little bitter, lemony.

Original rating:
11/VIII/2012 - 75cl bottle @ RBBSG - BB: n/a - 2007 vintage (2012-879) Thanks to Travlr for sharing the bottle!
Partly cloudy rustbrown beer, no head. Aroma: very fruity, raspberries, bit cheesy, little metallic. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: fruity start, raspberries, very sour, quite cheesy as well. Aftertaste: burning sourness, bit cheesy, little dirty, raspberry jam, bit metallic. Not bad, but overhyped if you ask me... Maybe the age is catching up on this. Still worth drinking though.
Ar: 6, Ap: 4, T: 8, P: 4, O: 15, Total: 3.7/5

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 (20/08/2012) thx. to Gene for another awesome whale // 2007 Vintage (only one) // 75 cl. bottle sampled @ RBBSG 2012 // murky dark brown / berry red with little in the way of a white head // nose is loaded with tart raspberries, hint of krieks, blended with delicious horse blanket, tad raspberry juice, small touch acid, damn rich for a fruit lambic this age // taste is insane amount of raspberries, like they just pounded them and tried to fit as many as possible into this bottle, even more than the fruit, this tastes heavily of raspberry pits, lots, some berries, tad cherries, freaking jam, real fruits overall, finishing with some sourness blended into the whole, funk, light barnyard, tad lemon, light acid // body is like raspberry pits and creamed raspberries // damn and people keep telling me that this used to better younger and that this is nothing compared to Framboos // man ////////////////////////////////////////////////// thx! to Dave for the sample. Tried a fresh one from the 2013 batch, really surprised as to just how similar this one is to the 2 bottles I tried from the 2007 batch. The new one is fruitier but does carry still a surprising amount of funk to it. Musty with noticeable kriek. This one is a bit simple but surprisingly still with barnyard notes in it. Not overly tart or anything, most surprising of all is that looking back the 2007 hadnt lost that much fruit compared to this one & gained some complexity. I do prefer the 2007 one unlike what I expected. This one is 4.7. Old one was 4.9. New score is 4.9 -> 4.8.

@ 2nd RBBSG, thx to Gene 
Head: slightly bubbly on top 
Colour: murly red 
Smell: lots of fruity sour fragerants, mostly raspberry with hints of the cherries 
taste: wondrfull fruity flavour with tarty acidic lambic flavour underneath. dry finish , very good !

750 ml bottle

Rating #2,000. For a milestone like this I had to break out a big gun. Rooting around in the cellar I found this to share with about a dozen others at a pre-GTMW tasting. Preceded by another monster (Blauw) it was the perfect way to finish an evening. I dont know how many bottles are still in the wild but I would love to try this one again. Even after five years it is fresh and tart.

Aroma / Appearance - The rosy red pour looks like someone blended a pound of raspberries then filtered out the pulp. Sparkling and brilliant it has only a trace of carbonation. The nose is sharp, acidic, and pure raspberries. It isnt rich and complex but it doesnt try to be blunt either. Despite the intensity it has an approach that makes it inviting and savory.

Flavor / Palate - Each sip is more intense than the one before until the taste buds begin to melt. Sharp raspberries taste like licking a handful which have been powdered with the residue from a bag of Sour Patch Kids. This top notch beer is something that American brewers can continue use as the ultimate benchmark. Somehow I think few will come anywhere close.

Sampled at RBBSG (bottle from 2007). Murky opaque red-brown color, no head just a slight off-white lacing. Smell strawberries, red currant, lightly sweet-sour. Taste is very sour, again strawberries and red currant. Medium carbo, medium body.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 Bottle @ De Heeren. After a long evening of excellent rare and vintage beers, I choose this baby to cap off the night. Lightly orangish pink, somewhat hazy appearance with a pink head. Super funky/cheesy, moderate barnyard, mild cobweb, very rich/deep raspberry, tart fruity aroma. The flavor is nothing short of unbelievable with notes of rich, fresh raspberries, funk, dust, mild cheese, dark berries, and light yeast. My new favorite raspberry beer.

Draft at brouwers with Linh and nhi. Pours a deep hazy ruby red with nice white lacing. Aroma is perfected tart raspberries and funky oak. Insane. End the review now. No, let me actually taste the beer. Mouthfeel is fizzy carbonation with delicious mouth puckerig tart, funky oak, sour raspberries and sour cherries.

Bottle shared by ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad!

The beer is ruby hued with an oily, thin head that leaves a good amount of lacing on the glass. The aroma is very musty, funky, and fruity. Dank basement comes to mind. The flavor is quite tart, with plenty of raspberries and a hint of cherries. Also a bit of oddness and bandaids, though these characteristics dont completely overrun the beer. The finish brings a puckering sensation in the cheeks (the ones on your face). A quality lambic. Recommended.

In bottle thanks Craig! Pours a dull ruby colour with a thin white head. A lovely musty aroma of raspberries, cherries, lemon, balsamic vinegar, oak and alcohol. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation, light CO2 prickle and a foamy mouth-feel. A lovely dry finish and beautifully tart. Stunning!
Bottle. Thanks Craig for sharing. Big funky musty aroma, ribena fruitiness, lambic notes, something remarkable I cant put my finger on. Similar taste, lots of funk and fruit. Tart. Excellent

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2012 Enjoyed this beer in 75CL format at Delirium Cafe in Brussels. Paid about 20 Euro for it and it was served in a Gueuze glass at cellar temp (around 60 Degrees F). I gave one third of the bottle to the bartenders who were interested in trying it. 

A - Absolutely zero pop of the cork. It just came right off with no hiss. I poured rather vigorously and had a quarter finger head that subsided quickly. Slight amount of bubbles on the edge of the glass. SRM was around 29. It was a dark blood red appearance that looks like raspberry skins or maybe plums depending on the light. 

S - Big grape scent. Im getting a nice oak backbone and pears. Raspberries clearly dominate the smell but age is starting to creep up it seems with lemon zest also coming through and a funky barnyard scent. 

T - Wow. Huge raspberry notes but the expected power feels a bit muted. Its big but not bold if that makes sense. Fading fruit seems to be common in beers of this type. No, the taste is slightly more vinegar than raspberry. Slightly tasting shoe polish and some chemical aspects to this beer. I get a decent level of cherries and ripe fruits.

M - Surprisingly, the carbonation while drinking had held up well. 10% carbonation on the mouth swish. Medium body and an incredible red wine dry finish. 

O - This is a unicorn beer for a lot of people. Its very tasty but has started to show signs of age. It could have been a complete sour bomb but has held up nicely. It would have been great to have this fresh.

*Update: I drank the sediment at the finish. Why not? Turned the beer less fruit and more bread like. Taste moved to a musky finish and more oak characteristics with some rotten grape. Still delicious.

Bottle shared at my 30:th birthday tasting on May 5 (30 år av Surt). Courtesy of sebletitje. Pours deep brownish red with a rather small pinkish white head that is rather quick to dissipate and doesnät leave much trace on the glass. Smell is tiny sweet, sour and fruity with raspberries, sour cherries, hay, dusty barnyard, lemon juice, lemon zest and hints of leather, horse blanket and oxidation. Taste is sour and fruity with raspberries, wood, horse blanket, sour cherries, lemon zest, wheat crackers, leather, dark grapes and hints of vinegar and bilberries. Mouthfeel is tart, dry, intense and medium to full bodied. Finish is sour, tart and fruity with raspberries, sour cherries, grape zest, lemon zest, wood, hay and hints of oxidation. Fruity, sour and plain incredible. Many thanks Seb for bringing me this!

Bottle at "30 år av surt", on May 5, 2012 in Göteborg. Bottled 14 dec. 2007.
Couleur pourpre/acajou, col fin beige léger.
Arôme est terreux, framboise garde un très beau bouquet fruité entre framboise et cerise qui prennent le dessus. On se rend tout de suite compte que 3F laisse loin derrière les qcq coupeurs qui eux préfèrent rajouter du sucre. On a donc ici, du vrai avec les fruits qui contribuent grandement au bouquet de cette bière, et garde même avec les années un bouquet très frais.

En bouche, aigreur prenante au palais avec ce profond profile framboise qui est divin, oscillant entre un côté champenoise et fruité de lambic donnant pleine vie aux framboises pour se développer. Ces dernières laissent une fin de bouche en picotement ui couvre le dessus du palais et la gorge. Vraiment une bière à déguster, et ces notes ne lui font pas vraiment justice. Au delà de la difficulté de la trouver, cela reste une très belle expérience gustative du début à la fin.

Bottle (75 cl), courtesy of sebletitje. Cloudy  ruby, medium pink head. Splendid fresh raspberry aroma, with clear notes of cherries, and some grapefruit. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Bone dry, extremely sour.

Bottle at "30 år av surt" on May 5, 201275 cl, Bottled 14/02/2007Murky copper color, very small pink head. Extremely sour scent, might just be the most sour beer I have ever smelled. Very sour, dry, yummy taste. Gut killing sour, so f***ing nice! Mouthpuckering sour and smooth mouthfeel, very low bitterness.One of the best beers Ive tasted.

Bottle with great thanks to the Wolf. Pours a hazy light copper colour with subtle red tinges. Smallish billowy light pinck head. Amazing complex earthy aromas of raspberries, brett and plenty of funk. Sublte acidity in the back ground. This is very good. Flavours are sweet thanks to the raspberries with a balancing tartness. Plenty of lambic sourness comes through in a very dry finish. Brilliant beer. Thanks heaps Rene.

30 år surt. Pours murky raspberry amber with a small pink beige head. Aroma is sour raspberries cherries malty a bit sweet. Flavor is great; fruity sweet, sour tart, so much berries, lemon buice, pungent slightly bitter. Great sour berry aftertaste.

Sampled at 30åravsurt
Hazy dark red.
Some asparagus in the aroma along with fruits; raspberries. Sour.
Fruity flavour along with high sourness.

thanks to Bluebetty for the bottle

pours a darker cherry color with a thin white collar. Not very impressive but it works. Nose however is another deal. Earthy raspberry and wood. Very nice and not in your face like others.  Good raspberry taste. Slightly dirty and slightly funky. Not over the top at all. nice sour dry finish. WOW thanks for this

A: Poured a bright reddish crimson body with a thin white cap 

S: The nose brings forward some Earthiness, puree raspberry and mustiness with some old spent wood 

T: Light funk, fresh and puree raspberries, woody and dirt with a hint of wood

M: Mouthfeel is light to medium with a sour, dry finish. 

O: Very good

Bottle shared by madtowndmb1...thanks Kyle! - Pours reddish and hazy, with a thin ring of off-white head. Nose is funky, with lots of stinky cheese, rotting raspberries, a touch of sulfur, and a layer of oak.Theres some plastic in there as well that I cant ignore, as it detracts from the nose overall. Taste is very similar, with rotting raspberry, cheese, and a bit of oak. Its got some plastic on the finish when its cold, but as it warms it smooths out nicely and the plastic recedes. Theres lots of fizzy carbonation that bites a bit. A bit of burn on the finish. Soft fluffy body. Really interesting, and Im glad I got to try it, but its waaay funky. A little too much for me, as Im not a stinky cheese sort of guy, but still good stuff.

75 cl bottle @ Delirium Cafe.
Rated on 20100718.
Pours murky brown color with small head. Aroma of raspberries, sour cherries and other berries, very ripe fruits and some sugar. Flavor of raspberries, sour cherries, ripe fruits, yeast and sugary caramel. Quite odd brew.

Thanks Kyle for sharing this 07 750ml. FUNKY rotting fruit on the nose. I like the smell, but it takes away from the flavor a bit. I love the raspberries and you have to if you are going to love this beer. So glad that I actually got to try this beer.
Bottle @ Mikkeller thanks to Bonkers. Red pour. Powerful aroma as soon as the bottle opened. Raspberries, barnyard, acidity. Extreme tartness. One of the best beers Ive ever had.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2014 Thanks to Bonke for selling me this! Pours hazy redish with no head. Aroma of nice deep fresh raspberries from the bush along with balsamic, lots of funk, cherries, vinegar, wild strawberries, a very weak note of lacto acid, brett, marzipan sweetness, a touch of candy, tart and alot of rural notes overall. Taste is very tart with those fresh wild raspberries straight from the bush, cherries, brett, weak acidic, balsamic, sour deep grapes, barnyard, red currants and overall extremely fresh! A nice reminder about why I love beer so much!

Had the Pleasure of tasting batch 2 as well. As I remembered this had an extremely nice balance between the extreme fruitiness and the funky rural notes. Its just so pleasing and very complex! Yet this was not a complete stunner as the first time I got it. Dont know if its because of batch 2 or because my taste buds changed or whatever. This time My rating would have been around 4,4/4,5 . But because my memory of this was so good (and rating 4,7) I am going to only bumb this down to a 4,6 . 

Amazing beer that is just top notch and which I could drink all day long!

Bottle. Pours a hazy copper, no head. Aroma is sweet, sour and heavy with raspberries and a touch of brett. Flavour is sour! Reminiscent of Berliner Weisse. Dusty raspberry sweetness in the background.; hard to pick u any other notes through the sourness. The sourness takes a bit getting used to, but then it becomes rather enjoyable and well-made, although still a bit on the heavy side. Finish is dry with raspberriesand a lingering sourness. Overall pretty good. 30.03.12.

What a way to celebrate my 750th rating!! Bottle at fridays tasting, thanks my man Rasmusott!! When poured, its hazy amber, slightly red, and it pours completely still - no head. Wow, the aroma is amazing! Deep, rich and juicy raspberry aroma - very authentic and absolutely marvelous. Moldy, dusty brettanomyces, very funky. Sweet raspberry jam, a hint of lactobaccilus, but (luckily,) mostly brettanomyces. Absolutely outstanding aroma. As soon as the beer hits the tongue, its vastly tart. Lots of tart raspberries and tart bacteria! Brettanomyces, barnyard and a lush, velvety touch of raspberry, which provides just the right amount of sweetness to create a near perfect balance - everything just comes together wonderfully. The beer is completely flat, no carbonation at all, but that just makes room for all the flavors to unravel all its complexity. Outstanding fruit lambic!

pour was a reddish pink, fairly clear, with a white frothy head that quickly dissipated. strong old oaky raspberry with a deep cherry backing. deep raspberry with a tart cherry favor. sour up front. strong oak flavor mixed in. sour but not acidic. very fruity with mild sweetness. moderate body, very woody, fruit lingers in mouth. i enjoyed this, was one of my favorites for the night. very interesting flavors and not overly raspberry forward. Reviewed on: 01-08-2012

HUGE thanks to xpimptastikx for bringing this beer to our impromptu/epic tasting last night. 750ml corked & caged bottle into a Ranger Creek tulip.

Hommage pours with a rosy, violet-amber hue studded with a fine yeasty haze. A pink, Valentines day head retains surprisingly well. Gorgeous beer! Sadly, the aroma has not held up to age as well as the appearance. Big phenolic notes greet the nose alongside a leathery, cheesy, funky armpit presence. Cooked asparagus and green olives were suggested, and I agree. However, sniff past the pickled funkiness and there are some nice acetic berry tones lurking beneath.

All is forgiven upon the first sip. This Lambic is heavenly in flavor, with a super tart lactic punch to the sides of the tongue offset by a decadent, funky raspberry jam note in the middle. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, and refreshing with a perfect carbonation level. Overall, an amazing beer; I am grateful that I got the opportunity to try Hommage. Its a shame the nose hadnt held up, but the deliciousness more than makes up for that fact. Thanks again Michael!

Bottle opened up with the St Valentines Cuvee Geuze since they were both about to turn 5.

A - Pours like carbonated cranberry juice as an inch of light pink head arises. A thin sheet stays around for awhile and leaves light lacing on the glass.

S - This is the wild card for this beer. First I got a very light raspberry jam followed by band aids, which seemed to have layers of musty cheese and pickled eggs. Someone else said green olives. There are raspberries, but they sit under some heavy funk layers.

T - Bright fresh raspberries still, raspberry jam, slightly acetic, but still a heavy dose of wet hay and cheese. Light vegital aftertaste. A better balance here than the nose, and my favorite fruit lambic from 3F.

M - light creamy carbonation with a nice oaky tannic finish, it leaves you lingering for more.

O - My favorite 3F fruit lambic to date. The nose was not as good as it could have been, but age might have something to do with that. Saying that, the 2007 Vintage we opened was not nearly as funky in the nose as the Hommage. I wish I was sitting on 3+ like some people, but a alas this was my only bottle.

I brought this one to our recent gueuze tasting. Been wanting to try this one for awhile now, glad I could share it with you all. 2007 bottle.

A - Pours murky pinkish red with a small half finger tall fizzy white head, dissipating down to a light film, leaving little to no lace down the glass.

S - Smell is all over the place. Hints of tart raspberries initially quickly changing with what I can only imagine sulfuric acid to smell like, ok maybe just some strong vinegar. It then changes again to dank basement funk and some medicinal band-aid. I can only imagine how this smelled fresh.

T - Starts off with a mix of tart raspberries and lactic sourness slowly giving way to a strong mineral flavor. Hints of vinous fruit skins, wet hay, dulled citric fruit and wet oak make up the rest of this one. Finish is very dry, lingering on the pallet for quite awhile.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Tart, dry feel with quite a bit of pucker, lingering for some time after consumption.

O - This beer really did live up to its reputation, changing nearly every time I took a sip. The pucker is strong but it is still manageable. I hope they do make this again, I would love to try it fresh.

2007 bottle at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas as part of my Pre-Wedding Celebrations. It pours a beautiful deep red colour, with a thick light pink head. The nose is tart red fruit (raspberry, cherry and red grapefruit), tangy raspberry syrup, acidity and wood. The taste is juicy, tart raspberry, strawberry, cherry, sour green apple, lemon, serious acidity and wood, with a massive tart finish. The juiciness of the fruit somehow manages to balance out the serious tartness. Medium body and lively carbonation. Absolutely delicious and utterly drinkable! Probably the best fruit lambic Ive had to date.

Bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontainas during Pauls celebration. Pours cloudy ruby with a big, soft pink head. Dry raspberry aroma. Light to medium sweet with a soul-piercing sourness, some refined raspberries. Medium bodied with lively, tingly and smooth carbonation. Lovely tart finish with pure, aged and lightly dry raspberries. Lasting lip-puckering sour notes. Very fresh. Hugely drinkable. The sour character grabs ahold and doesnt let go. Excellent.

750 ml bottle sampled at STLWills 30th birthday party. I got the last of it, the pudding. Bottled 2/14/2007. My pour was a muddy reddish-brown with no head - probably less muddy and less brown before me. Aroma of raspberry, oaky funk, sour cherry, herbs, some toast, and a surprising amount of earthy, vegetal notes. Flavor of very sour raspberry, lemon juice, earth, oaky funk, vanilla, and lactic acid. Medium-bodied, with a tart, sour mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Not as dry as others we tried that night. Very cool.
Bottle shared over the new years with an adventurous German friend. Nice. We both liked it.

Pours orange-tinged ruby into a tumbler. Pink head quickly fizzles to hug rim. Funky cherry and barnyard aromas. Sharp, tart berries and funky barnyard from front to back turning to a lasting sour lactic finish.

Thanks for sharing this Brad. Comes in a big green champagne bottle and a cork. Served in a snifter. 

Beer is reddish and my pour near the top is mostly clear with a few floaters. Minimal head of white medium bubbles, other pours got some head though. Carbonation is moderate and the lacing is low. Looks good.

Aroma is musky and quite acetic. There is some nice lactic acid notes in there as well.

Beer is thin and strongly acetic. Finishes dry ultimately with this odd bitterness in there. Very drinkable although I imagine the high sourness would eventually get to me. Mouthfeel is good.

Serving type: bottle

Bottle thanks to Levi, thanks a ton for this one!  Pour is a clear cherry red, with a billowing white head tinged with a touch of pink.  Fair lacing. Aroma is a big hit of cherry tartness, some white fruit funkyness, light oak/tannic berry seeds. As it breaths a bit, the fruit aromas muddle to more general fruitiness that works nicely.  Slightly medicinal plastic notes lingering on the end.  Taste is lots of tart fruit seeds, a fair bit of biting acetic acid.  Some more medicinal plastic notes lingering on the end.  Nice beer, cut back on acid a bit and it would be great!

Bottle, huge thanks to Levi for popping this bottle! 750 mL bottle from 2007, pour is deep cherry red with thin slightly off white head.  Aroma brings notes of big sour cherry, raspberry, sweet vanilla, slight off plastic but not bad at all, lemony pucker as well with a hint of funk, but the berries somehow are crazy overpowering.  Taste is a nice mix of funky tart, big raspberry and slight sour cherry mixing into some slight acetic sour, hints of vanilla, slight carbonic acid tartness in there as well, touch of cheesy notes, touch of medicinal plastic-y notes as well that fades quick into a funky, tart finish.

Bottle shared by MatSciGuy!  Hazy black cherry pour, a little carbonation and more tart cherries on the nose.  Flavor is acetic cherry, earthy sourness and a nice lingering fruit aftertaste.  Thanks for sharing this Levi, really enjoyed it!

#1002 bottle; Nose is raspberry acids, almond, dry leaves, soapy whiff, weak sweet alcohol, later weak sweet rosehip, feel is quite wine like, carb is mediumheavy, taste is decent murky earth notes, underripe green apple, some citrus, then medium grape
Bottle thanks to Brad. Pours muddy and dirty berry brown. Nose/taste of tart berry fruit, cheese, oak and berry vinegar. Medium body. Nice acidity.

Pours cloudy red with off-white head. Big aroma attacking the nose, sour vinegar, raspberries, cherries, cherry pits. Im surprised that the cherry pits play such a big role in the aroma. Taste is dominated by raspberries, tart, light vinegar taste. Acidic finsish, not overly sour, balanced. Great beer!

75 cl bottle @ Delirium Café, Brussels. Rated on 18.07.2010
Aroma has raspberries and redcurrants. Flavour is sour and rather berryish with raspberries and redcurrants. Also some hints of cherries. Good, but too berryish and a bit disappointment.

Thanks to fiver29 for sharing this. Date on this is 2-14-07. Pours pinkish orange with just a bit of white head. Smell: Funk, raspberries, hay, barnyard and horse blanket. Taste: Sour cherry, raspberry, hay, refreshing sour funkyness. Very nice mouth pucker with a dry finish.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar. September 17, 2011

Pours deep muddy red. Big fantastic aromas of raspberries, a hint of cherries and all kind of other sour forest fruits. Its vivid and alive and surprisingly fresh. The taste is filled with sourish raspberries with a spicy vibe. Its rich, full and pretty much perfect in terms of fruit lambics.

75cl bottle at home, vintage 2007. Synthetic cork. I was too drunk to form a decent conclusion the first time I tried this in DHVL but the bottle at home is certainly good! Lots of fresh raspberry on the nose with not much funk. No head but a lively carbonation. Palate is oily. Lots of raspberry in the flavour but not the most complex fruit beer. Id say this still has a lot of ageing potential!

This beer was superb. I couldnt get over how fresh the raspberry tasted, hugely drinkable. the mouth feel was light with fine carbonation. Taste was moderately sour with plenty of funk and a tidal wave of fresh raspberries. Exceptional!!

Thanks to beddachedda or westcoastbeerlvr (not quite sure).  Second time that Ive tried it and this glass seemed better, somehow.  Pours a cloudy golden pink.  Aroma is a big and wonderful sour raspberry flavor - the sour cherries just seem to punch up the berry flavor - with some nice funk, mildly cheesy.  Taste has a lot of sourness.  Everything comes together well.  Pretty good pucker - ~7/10.  Tried at the same time as Malvasia and preferred that one but only by a small margin.  Another excellent lambic from 3F.
750 ml bottle.  A nice murky red color with a light white head that disapears rather quickly.  A nice earthy fruity flavor.  More please.

Thanks John!  Loved this one!  Pours a bright ruby red with a small head.  Smells of wonderful earth, strong acid, raspberries, a touch of funk, barnyard.  Strong acidic raspberries on the palate with an intensely strong lip pucker.  A bit of earth and funk with a nice barnyard backdrop.  The raspberries are bright and clear.  The finish is strongly acidic.  The mouth feel is light and lively.  Excellent!

Bottle pours clear reddish color with off white head.  Aroma is sour vinegar, raspberries, horse blanket.  Lively mouthfeel from the carbonation.  Taste follows the nose.  There is a robust raspberry taste that makes this a very good brew.  There is some noticeable oxidation beginning to set in.  It wasnt enough to detract from the deliciousness this beer has to offer.  It was just noticeable.  A great beer.

4/15/11. 750mL bottle. Cloudy red pour with a small fluffy off-white head that fades to a ring. Bright raspberry aroma with a hint of cherry in there with a definite hint of aging, rotten fruit... borderline sweatsock. Tart raspberry flavor with a bigger cherry punch and a mix of nice pie spices.

Bottle shared by the Bastardos at Muckfest II on 6/25/11. Clear red pour with a sparse head thats gone quickly. Raspberry vinegar aroma with slight pepper and some malty sweetness. Feety raspberry flavor with some bile and vinegar before a super sour finish.

A: The beer pours a slightly hazed pinkish-red color with a tall off-white head.

S: Intensely funky aroma.  Very earthy with a bit of a mineral quality.  Strong acidity and a mild vinegar note.  Still an amazing amount of raspberry to it.  Straw, grass, and lemon zest give it that typical Drie Fonteinen aroma.

T: The mineral note is very prominent here.  Lots of raspberries provide a touch of sweetness and a very nice sourness.  Acetic notes are in check and a lot of the sourness is more lactic.  Straw lemon, wet grass, and a nice earthiness.

M: Medium in body with a medium to high carbonation.

O: Not always a big framboise fan, but this was pretty damn good.

This poured a semi cloudy darkish purple with a pinkish beige head. Aroma was of lots of sour cherries and berries, light funk as well as some wood. Flavor was very lactic and tart, lots of sour fruits espcially the cherries and nice oaky wood character as well. Great Fruit Lambic.

Have had this one a few times now. For me its always enjoyable. I like that sour, tart, fruity flavor. Comes across as a bit of mixed berry, cherry, raspberry, etc.. A bit acidic and get that tingle from the wood in this one. Latest bottle was quite smooth, very tart and bordering that really acidic note.
Bottle. Pours reddish with an off white head. Funky fruity aroma, with oak and raspberries. The flavor is funky, fruity, and oaky, but has a strange corny notes. Not bad.

Süß-saurer Marmeladengeruch. Mittelsaurer Antrunk mit angenehmer Himbeernote, die, wie gewünscht, trotz ihrer Präsenz meist im Hintegrund bleibt und der Säuerlichkeit den Vortritt lässt. Die Säuerlichkeit bleibt so auf konstanter Intensität, im Hintergrund wird die Fruchtigkeit unkenntlicher, bleibt aber prinzipiell vorhanden. Ausgewogenes Verhältnis, nicht zu sauer, spritzig. Zum Ende etwas saurer, sehr angenehm, passend. Sehr ausgewogenes Lambic, perfekt für den Sommer! Vielen Dank an den Doppelbock für das Bier! 9/12/13/12/12/12

750ml Bottle with a Big Thanks to ditmier for sharing this. Pours out redish amber topped with a small white head. Aroma was nice with light funk, Brett, raspberries, light cherries, and some tart. Taste was as the aroma with lots of berries and a good sweetness.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2012 Huge thanks to ygtbsm94 for opening this bottle last weekend. Served in a Bruery tulip.

Pour yields a bright red body with a thin white head that nearly immediately fades to a thin collar around the edges. The nose brings forward some slight earth along with quite a bit of musty raspberry. In the background, theres a bit of light oak. Overall, the nose is kind of like a damp vineyard. Theres a bit of bandaid lingering in the background of the nose, though this disappears in the flavor. Taste has a good amount of raspberry and damp earth. Light wood and a moderate amount of acidity. Mouthfeel is light to medium with a sour, dry finish. Not too much funk anywhere, more toward a light earthiness. Overall, a very nice beer with the mouthfeel as the highlight.

REVISITED: Thanks to TurdFurgison for sharing.  This bottle is much better with musty, earthy raspberry and accompanying funk plus a bright lactic acidity without any acetic notes.

Otrolig stor och fruktig doft som sprider sig snabbt.
Smak av körsbär, ek, hallon och en lite annorlunda varm ton som jag inte har känt i en lambic tidigare.
En kryddig och len eftersmak som ger den en extra fyllig karaktär. Mycket, mycket gott.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar, April 2011. 

Hazy dark red with a small white head. Lovely aroma of tart fruits, wood, some spices and notes of raspberries. Excellent taste of fruits, raspberries, wood and some spices. Nice funkiness with a good tartness. Really a great beer with a huge drinkability. Perfect mouth feel. I want more!

750ml bottle, thanks ksurkin! Tart aroma, raspberry, cherry, slight hint of rotten fruit. Tart, smooth, raspberry, cherry. Delicious. Tastes great but this might be slightly on the downhill. Still amazing.

Thanks to Alex for sharing this on Brys birthday. 750ml bottle served in a Bells tulip...A reddish mud brown water poor, light pink head, good retention...The aroma is great with a ton going on. Funky, a super fresh and most accurate raspberry taste, there is also a distinct aroma of strawberries. The funk is the perfect amount...Taste is great, funky, the exact amount of puckering tartness to make you happy but not so much you cant drink the whole bottle yourself. Light sweetness adds to a great drinkability.

Consumed at DHvL. Looks good. Reddish pink/ornage hue. Not much in the way of a head. Corn. Smells like corn and spoiled vegetables. Cream corn at that. Tastes almost as bad as it smells. This doesnt seem like a lambic to me, or a fruit one at that. This might have been a mistake that was bottled up and sent out. Hopefully it was just the bottle I got, or I should say that my wife got. I couldnt get past one sip. Maybe it was bad storage or an infection, but this was a horrible beer. I cant imagine that this was the intended result. Especially after consuming all the other great offerings from Armand.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2012 Re-Rate from lambic trip.  Numbers from this rating and slightly higher than previous rate.  Very funky, tons of cheese funk with an earthy dusty aroma.  Seedy raspberry and cherry, flesshy and bright.  Not is funky in the taste, still cheese rind coming through strong, dusty brett note with rich fleshy raspberry.  Light body, creamy soft feel, dry finish and moderate carb.
***
A-pours a transparent bright reddish amber color with a creamy off white head.

S-this has some light earthy funk notes to it, hints of leathery brett, bright ripe raspberries that are dried out but fresh, reasonably sour and light acidity in the nose.

T-the funk is again earthy but very light, the brett is more pronounced and assertive adding leather in with the tart green raspberry, there seems to be some juicy cherry as the raspberries are dry and sweet with a hint of tartness and light acidity in the finish.

M-lighter body, very juicy creamy feel to it with a moderate carbonation and hint of driness.

D-this has a nice little balance to it.  not the funk I would have expected from a drie fonteinen beer but the fruit flavor is very pronounced.  actually more acidic than I thought it would be but not burning.  the body is so juicy and creamy on the palate it is very inviting.  the flavors are subtle and well integrated.

Red with a thin white head. Aroma is sour, vinegar, raspberries, cherries. Taste is a light red wine vinegar like character, raspberries, and cherries show with light funkiness, lightly acidic. something about this reminded me of consecration. I guess that happens if you drink this right after cable car.

Shared by fellow lambic enthusiast Weisguy for our small sour tasting. 750ml Valentines Day 2007 bottling ♥
Hommage pours medium amber red and not too dark to see through. The smell is crazy! I get very rotten, sweet fruit--especially raspberry--along with funky puke, poop, rhubarb & cheese. The taste definitely connects to the smell, but is much less offensive to me with tons of funky raspberry & hearty fruit. Mouthfeel is light-medium with moderate carbonation. The finish is not very dry, but a bit sweet. 
Not very close to what I was expecting and in a negative way because it was hard to get passed the smell. I think this may have been an off bottle or improperly stored. Will re-review if I get to try it again.
11th November 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Sharp and mouth water inducing sourness. Fruity and with a dry finish. Not bad but cant drink a lot.

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Deep red in colour. Clear at first, but got tomato juice muddy very quickly. Medium carbonation. Aromas are of barnyard, raspberry jam, diaper pail, uncrushed black peppercorns, and wood. Loads of black raspberry and stalk in the mouth, along with more funk and lemon curd. Moderate acidity and medium bodied. The depth and darkness of the fruit seems quite unique. Very impressive indeed. Im really glad that oakbluff decided to share this one.

Rich red with a heavy lacing white head. Nose has tart unripe raspberry sourness, syrupy sweetness from cherries, a bit tepid. Flavor has some acidity, more sweetness and softness through the very dry finish, more cherry up front and raspberry in finish. Well carbonated and well integrated, cherry and raspberry, the fruit very strong despite a balance with the lambic elements.

Bottle shared at the LCBS 10.  The pour was a cloudy ruby red.  Aromas of raspberry and other light berries.  The taste followed suit with big raspberry, sour cherries, and other acidic fruits...  Really  amazing...

2007 bomber - thanks to Yves Panneels for helping me track this beer down. Shared with buds this weekend. Pours a cloudy, cherry red with a small foamy head. Great nose of tart fruit and raspberry. Nicely carbed. A little wood and mineral flavor adds to the sweetness.. Has an insane amount of berries floating on the palate, mixing with the funk to make this a  fantastic fruit lambic for me. Yummy stuff!

750mL from Maxs in Baltimore. Celebrating my 1700th rating with Travlr. Pours a murky pink (later will look like brown mud with the massive yeast sediment) with a medium, rocky, pinkish white head. Excellent retention. No lace. Aroma starts off as phenolic, sort of band-aid kriek, but moves thankfully to cherry pie, raspberry sorbet, raspberry yogurt, fresh pears, some spicy sourness, very rich and complex. Taste is perfection- massively lactic with a major mouth-watering component that forces to drink this is giant gulps and unfortunately it is hard to keep this rarity in the glass to savor. You want more every second. Raspberry yogurt, grape seed, fresh cherries, light spicy white wine vinegar. Lactic sourness moves to a bit spicy, all-encompassing sour for a split second before the palate is zipped away into a fresh, understated dryness. The coating mouthfeel leaves you with an oily texture on the palate even though the body here is spritzy, refreshing.

Bottle. Pours hazy red, thin white head, spotty lacing. Nose os Schaarbeek cherries, ultra-tart, very dry, light earthiness. Flavours are tart cherries, lovely raspberry notes as well, funky barnyard, some real "cold cream" floral and petroleum notes too. Very soft yet tart and assertive, lovely.

6 or 7 ounce sample at De Heeren van Liedekerkes beerfest. Pours a bright red color with a large white head. The aroma is sweet berries, certainly the raspberries dominate. The flavor is very nice; a thin body, lots of sweet raspberries and sweet cherries, some wood and light yeast . Enjoyable.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2012 2007 bottle shared with the wife on August 14 2010 at Kulminator in Antwerpen.
A: A lighter shade of cherry red best describes the fairly transparent body. Moderate sized pinkish head didnt stick around long and only left behind the faintest traces of lacing on the glass.
S: Mmm. A bright tart raspberry aroma finds its way to the nose immediately upon the beers arrival at our table. A little sweet with just a hint of cherry notes. Good oak presence but not a whole lot of musty funk, however.
T: Gentle raspberry sweetness and tartness from start to finish. Oak and funk take a bit of a back seat to the fruityness. A little shiraz like fruity pepper. 
M: Smooth with a moderate effervescence. Despite the sweetness of the raspberries up front, Hommage finishes nice and dry. Solid, but not mind melting tartness.
