O: Quite a treat. Looking forward to Hommages rumored return in the near future.

Bottle looks very good, the beer in the glass as well. Moldy-fruity aroma. Starts quite sourish without being too much, very fruity like berries from the beginning, good balance between sour and fruity. Moldy notes still there, wonderful prickly. Well balanced finish, fruityness dominating. Quite drinkable and a great beer!

My bottle from West Lakeview. Bottled 2007, opened at RBSG 10. Pours a very attractive pinkish-brown with pale pink bubbles on top. Nose strikes you with typical soft sourness of 3F and raspberries, as well as sour cherry notes. Some grass as well. On taste, it is still young. Lots of tannins abound that will prop this up for years. Raspberries and tart cherries, clean acid. Some cheesy notes, in a good way. The jam elements of the fruit really stand out, along with the puckering astringency from the tannins. This will be amazing in another 3-5 years.

Thanks to NobleSquirrel for saving me some at the grand tasting, RBSG 2010. The most amazing raspberry and jam aroma. Wonderful fruit. Perfect flavor, the best fruit lambic Ive had. Very jammy, with a perfect sour edge, a little yogurt, lactic creaminess, a perfect package.

Sampled at the RBSG Summer Grand Tasting (Grand Rapids, MI). Pours a rusty reddish brown, good almost copper, with a murky underbelly. A lacing offwhite near tan head, ring. Aromas are huge: funky cheese takes the lead, raspberries, soured with funky dusty brett, oak. Big brett funk with sour and sweet raspberries. Initial is surprising, change of pace into sour raspberries, puree, a light sweetness, very dried out with just that touch of kriek peeking through a bit. Dry bretty funk take hold on the backend, with powerful sourness, rounded out brett, lighter malts. Really sticks the funk and sourness long term to the palate with fruity raspberry, tart and sweet synergy, mixing well. An honor to try and a masterful fruit lambic, the aroma really is its strength for me but its very well balanced, sour with suffiicient sweetness, potent funk.
750ml bottle. Aroma of berries, oak and funkiness. Murky maroon color. Taste is tart raspberries, acetic & lactic acid, wood & vanilla. Nice tartness, great fruit flavor.
Bottle 0,75ltr: Pink coloured lambic with an gentle sour taste and some fruity sweetness.

(Old BA rate - bottle(
Lightly hazy ruby red-orange color; fizzy white head; the color on this is really interesting. Tart dark cherries with fresh berry aromas; touch of funk and only a hint of sweetness comes in. Berry-like freshness and acidity; light vinegary flavors; sour and tart; funky, but really nice dark fruitiness about it as well. Medium to light; a little syrupy; very fizzy carbonation. Very drinkable as the complexity drew me in and the tart, but very well-balanced flavors, kept the drinking easy. Overall, probably one of the best brews that Ive tried to-dat
Bottle from 07. Thanks eric. Pours a nice red color with a pink head. Has a sour cherry smell with a bit of brett. Has a sour cherry taste that finishes nice and tart.

Bottle, 75cl corked. From trade with jbrus, thx a lot John! Its an almost clear and copper beer with a medium sized off-white head. Cellar, barnyard and raspberry in the aroma. Its medium bodied and tart, with lemon, a good dose of raspberries and some barnyard in the back. The finish is a nice blend of lemon and raspberry flavors. A good throat burn is left too. Nice. 091230
Bottle. Red colour with a pink head. Aroma is cellar, raspberry, acidic. Flavour is acidic, raspberry, cellar, cherries. Nice beer.

750ml bottle purchased and consumed at Monks Cafe in Philly this past weekend with beerloco, mrs. beerloco, deliriumfest, ms. deliriumfest, and dbhog!

Appearance: raspberry colored body with minimal pinkish white crown that shows little retention or lace.

Smell: loads of raspberries, some nice funky notes, and a wonderfully tart acidity. really impressive nose.

Taste: an overload of sour raspberries, acidic lemon notes, an impressive amount of tart dryness, and just enough funk. WORLD CLASS!

Mouthfeel: Thin bodied and the slightest amount of chewiness imaginable!

Drinkability: I would score it higher but the amount of tartness, dryness, and acidity holds it back.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-22-2009

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2011 this might be the most beautiful beer ive ever seen.  2007
nose: raspberry jam, plastic bung, jizz tree?  dogwood?  some flowering tree that smells good and bad at the same time.  red wine vinegar, my moms old lancome perfume.  actually a bit subdued in the nose.
mouth: mj says to take a big gulp, like youre a farmer who drinks this every day.  this beer is happy and vivacious.  tight n tiny carbonation, but a bit too fizzy.  a bit plasticky, pomegranate seeds, natural juicy sweetness, foam rubber?  shoulder pads?  sour finish hits sinuses a bit.  hint of dill, mustiness.  very long finish with red wine vin on top, rasp sweetness below.  i almost love it, but theres a hint of something off--plastic/floral/foam rubber uneasiness.
Bottled 75cl. Huge raspberry and barnyard aroma. Very musty. The raspberries dont add to my appreciation of this beer. Good, very complex and unique. Good sourness. But not really my kind of beer.

Bottle in the parking lot at Dark Lord Day, courtesy of sprinkle, who was one of the many really nice people I got a chance to meet that day.  Pours a ruby and crimson hued orange brown with a medium sized soft fuzzy head.  Aroma is just gorgeous.  Enough so that I stopped taking notes on it for a minute and just stood around smelling it for a bit.  So pretty.  Soft raspberries, clean and fuzzy with a pure clean funk.  Pretty caramel tones throughout it, lovely funky raspberry.  Great tannic, sweet, funky finish.  So tasty.  Thanks again for sharing this Mike.

Celebrating my rating nr. 400 with some of the best stuff from the cellar. This big beauty of a fruity lambic is defenately one of favorite beers and its a great feeling to share this with my self, all alone without sharing. The glassware is off cause a autentic 3 Fontainen glass bought in  the restaurant in Beersel where I spend a fab. eavening in 08 with a lot of mugs full of nice lambic and gresat pieces of meat on the plates...need to go again.... soon. Well on to the beer. 75 cl bottle stamped 14.02.2007. The pour is a cloudy brownish red with a  fizzy pink head. The aroma is enormous. Packed with raspberries in both bitter sour and in sweet caracters. Some winegums and mabel sirup toms the aroma spectrum. The taste is all that you want it to be. Its perfectly balanced between the sour impression and the fruity and  sweet notes. The raspberries is overwhelming and fades out in to a calm and light  bitter finish. The carbonation level is rather high and gives it a lively feeling in your mouth leading to a mild oily and buttery feeling. 
I have yet to taste a better lambic than this one - damn

bottle at RBWG, pours dark pink with a thin white head.  Cheesy aroma with some berry notes.  This is powerful stuff.  Lots of berry and tart cherry and strawberry notes with a super dry and sour finish.  Im not the biggest sour fan, but this stuff rocked.

Bottle, at the Orlando Rate Beer Winter Gathering.  Thanks to whomever brought this, Im sorry I totally bogarted it.  I took a huge pour.  Everything you would expect.  Sweet and tart with a great sourness.  I had it following a Cantillon St. Lamvinus and it was similar and stood right up there with what I think is one of the best brews out there.  The raspberries really stand out, creating a fruity tartness.  Great brew.

750 ml bottle; February 2007 batch; word, thanks Tom!! Pours dense reddish orange with thin white head; cherries, nicely tart, musky and almost geuze-y cheese; drinks with a fizzy sweetness; cherries, apples, poppy funk; crazy dry and incredible yummy; delicate, subtle and creamy sour; yeah!!

25.4 oz bottle.  Pink orange with a perky white cap.  Nose is raspberry, wet hay, lemon curd and light funk.  Sharp, piercing carb provides a zing in every sip.  Finishes creamy and mouth watering.  Wonderful bracing acidity.  Taste is wild raspberry, yoghurt and sour lemon candy.  Just enough sweet to keep the tartness from dominating.  Sublime elegance.

Tasted from bottle at Lush CBC event courtesy of Dr. Bill.  Pours red-orange with a thin pink head.  The nose is of Kirsch cherries, sour apple and raspberry, and vinegar.  The flavor is a drying sour with cherry, raspberry, and bitter blood orange.  There is also a bit of a sweet grenadine on the mid-palate.  The carbonation is very much alive with a medium, almost tannic body.  The finish is very long with cherry flavor.  This is an amazing beer that I feel lucky to have tasted.  Thank you Dr. Bill!

Got to try this at a recent BA/RB tasting in Portland, OR. Colour... cloudy amber with no head. Nose... very fruity (mostly bramble fruits) and acetic. Palate... tart, loads of raspberry, other cane berry flavours seem to come through even if not in the mix, rather acetyl and a decidedly short finish, but good golly what and intro!

UPDATED: APR 17, 2010 Enjoyed at a recent BA/RB tasting...  Wow!  Just wow!  Bottle poured a foggy, off-pink.  Pungent, tart sour nose that was borderline dank and feet-like.  But the raspberries really came through in the flavors offering a sweet, tangy balance to the sharp sourness of the beer.

750 ml bottle shared by a friend.  Pours a slightly hazy pinkish red color with a small white head.  The aroma is tart raspberries splashed with a touch of sour cherries.  There is an overall funk with this as well and some damp cellar notes for good measure.  The flavor opens very fruity with raspberries and cherries prominent.  Hints of wood , vanilla, and funk are all present.  I expected this would have more sweetness than it does, probably because of the fruit flavors.  This instead moves from mildly sour to simply tart but remains very drinkable at all times.  Medium bodied.  Although I enjoyed this, its hard to place it because I havent had very many good examples of lambics to properly compare.

Finally got up the courage to bust open my bottle at a tasting today and was definitely rewarded.  Big thanks to Papsoe for trading me this gem.  Just a phenomenal beer, with a spectacular balance of fruit and sourness, an absolutely delicious beer that was really unfair to everything I tasted after it.

Aroma is sour fruit, medium malt, yeast.  Taste is sour fruit, medium malt, yeast.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2011 (Bottle, thanks mybestfriend) Pours beautiful glowing red with some orange hints. Sand coloured to pale pink head. The aroma holds fresh, lively raspberries up front, but there is also some notes of cherries in the background. Undertones of cinnamon, bitter almonds, mouldy basement, smoke/smoked sausage-like phenols and some Tai food - coconut milk, ginger and lime. The brett is very subtle; there is only a hint of horse blanket. Light wheat. The flavour is light sweet/dry and medium heavily acidic. More citrus than raspberries and cherries. Good balance between lacto and barnyard-ish brett. The mouthfeel is fresh and tart with a light tannin feel to it. Citrus and raspberries lingers. Medium bodied. Fantastic and complex yet very drinkable.

75cl bottle, RBWG.  Medium off-white head atop strawberry juice body.  Aroma is medium sweet, cherry, some strawberry, funk.  Taste is medium sweet, cherry/strawberry, some funk.  Light-medium body, some acidity.

pours blood red with no head. aroma bursts with tart cherries, raspberries, earthy, vinegar. drinks with tons of juicy tart cherries with pit and sweet raspberries. tartness peeks through the whole drink with just enough pucker to make you want more and more. finishes sweet with tons of fruits and berries coating the palate. just amazing.
Bottle shared by Sparky27.  Thanks E!  Hazy maroon pour with a small head.  Another great 3F lambic.  Loaded with cherry, funk, vinegar and light malt.  Very good stuff!

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2010 Bottle at RBWG, courtesy Rciesla. pours reddish hue with sharp lacing and white head. nose is big on tart fruit, with a pretty heavy dose of rubber, but overall balanced by the big fruity touch. flavor has more assertive fruit punch than the nose, with a very welcoming tart factor over everything. body is smooth and healthy, very easy drinking.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2010 750mL bottle at Monks Cafe.  Pale, deep cloudy pink with not too much head.  Smells incredible, like fresh picked raspberries with minor acidity and sweetness, very well balanced nose.  Tastes just like raspberries at first, finishing with a nice balance of funk and acidity, its gentle and pleasant.

750 ml bottle. Almost clear, reddish body with a big, pink head. Aroma is acidic with a light cellar note. Flavor is refreshing light cherry and other red berries, moderate acidic and light funky! Very nice and quaffable, almost a bit to average in accordance with expectations from 3 fonteinen. Balanced and very nice anyway.
Bottle at Maxs.  Pours pinkish red.  The aroma is raspberry and olive.  The flavor is tart and sour with again raspberry and olive.  This is one of the most incredible beers Ive ever had.

A: Pours a pinkish red hue with an average sized pinkish white head that quickly disappears.

S: Lots of raspberry, strawberry, wild mild funky notes as well, and a weird sort of rubber smell.

T: There is some raspberry and loads of acid, but there is something wrong with this beer. The taste of burnt rubber dominates. I think something has gone wrong here. ISO another bottle to rerate.

M: Medium in body, a long rubber like after taste.
Thick deep red-pink pour with little head.  Lots of pure fresh fruity raspberry aroma.  Almost not funk or vinegar.  Best aroma on a lambic.  Sour fruitiness with lots of raspberry.  Fantastic.

Eagle poured me this one, thanks Brian!! Medium sized pink head, good retention and lace. Lightly hazy amber red body. Gorgeous nose of funk , fruit and wood, lightly musty. Body is light with a palate cleansing acidity, nicely tart and tannic. Well balanced flavors of raspberry, light citrus, mellow lumber with some cherries and apples, earthy and funky. Pleasently puckering dry long finish. A really nice beer. Props to Brian for sharing. Lovely brew indeed.

Bottle enjoyed at the NSSRQSOSLT, 1/10! Thanks to me, who brought this one, another fine one of the night! The pour was ruby-mahoganey, nice generous pink colored head, steady carbonation bubbles rising to the top. The aroma was tart raspberries, funky barnyard elements, oak, and I guess cherries. The flavor followed, raspberries tart but not over the top, a pretty unoffensive but assertive sour brew, lighter fruits underneath, oaky finish. The mouthfeel was clean, acidic, featuring even a faint residual sweetness, perhaps. Excellent, shoulda bought two bottles on the day I saw this out of the few it was on the shelf at SL a year and a half ago or so.

From notes. Ruby pour, minimal carbonation. Raspberry, cherry, earthy old wood, barn funk, red burgundy wine, plenty of acidity. Flavor is a bit sweeter, less sour. Medium body, low carbonation, juicy. This sample was not long after it was released, need to try it again soon.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2010 Bottle from eaglefan538 thousand!?! Shared at roberts house. Nice muddy red color. Tart aroma. Taste is nice... Slight tartness of some cherries and raspberries. Overall a little sweet as well. Acid level is high. Really smooth and easy to drink. I wonder how old this bottle is/was? Good beer.

2007 vintage.

Reddish pink color with a sparkling pink head that settles quickly.

A great smell, clean and well defined. Great aromas of tart raspberries and cherries. The fruitiness is very pleasant, acidic, genuine and pulpy. Some gentle funky notes. Grass, earth and yeast - the usual lambic suspects are present but subdued due to the fresh fruitiness.

The taste follows suit with a beautiful fruit character of semi-sweet and tart raspberries and cherries. Pleasant acidic character all the way. The fruits are just unbelievably well defined and rich. Notes of grass, dusty cellar, earth and just a hint of funky wet hay. Fruit pits, some barrel notes. The finish is very dry and rather sparkling with a nice sourness and lingering fruit aromas. A very gentle, well balanced and pleasant taste.

Medium body, gentle yet active carbonation.

This is a fantastic beer. Great, razor sharp fruit profile and clean flavors. Good balance between the fruits and the rustic lambic flavors. Refreshing and easy to drink.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)

Bottle @ Ebenezers. Beautiful pour; dark rose/plum pour with an effervescent head. Aroma is magnificent; start is an insane raspberry character that melds into cherry. From there, a woody and vanilla tone emerges, with some interesting spice ideas, much like nutmeg. Throughout all of these stages, a beautifully mellow barnyard funkiness provides the foundation of the nose. Flavor is out of control; the tart cherry is phenomenal, and the raspberry sweetness compliments it adeptly. Really nice secondary tier of flavors includes pear, apple cider, oak, and grape skin. Palate is full, with a bone dry finish. Exceptional lambic.

The pour is a murky rose in color  with a patchy white veneer. Aroma is bursting and vivacious with loads of pureed raspberries that culminate with distinct funken cherry notes near the end. Further notes are prolific and hard hitting, manifesting in with wet hay, straw, barn, and subtle earthen funk. The flavor makes my jaw drop with wonder and intrigue. Massive raspberry is prevalent, while the sour cherry is accentuated by the wild yeast arrangement. Pear and apple with mild notes of acetic acid, grapeseed, and super subtle tannins. The palate is full, mildly effervescent, slippery in the body, and dry in the finish. Perhaps the best fruit lambic Ive ever had.

75 cl bottle shared with friends.
pours red-orange, settles dark red, not much head.
ripe strawberries, vineagra inthe aroma. sweet strawberries and acid vineagra aroma clashes.
flavor is acid vineagra, balanced by sweet rasberries and sour and sweet cherries.

750ml courtesy of JAXON and shared at the Black Friday tasting with the Phoenix crew.  Pours cloudy maroon with a thin white head.  The nose is cherry skins, sea water, light horse blanket.  The taste is red wine vinegar, tart cherry, salted fruits and light funk.  Medium prickly mouthfeel.  Delicious stuff.

yet another ridiculous bottle shared by sparky27 on 11/27/2009. bottle dated feb 14 2007.

pours cloudy raspberry tinted brown with a white collar. 

man, it smells like a garbage bin... only garbage water made its way through and was allowed to sit overnight with the bag still in... rotten garbage water about sums it up. but, not in a repulsive way. that rotten umami stink mixes with dusty basement, raspberry and its tartness, herbal, some minerality and worcestershire sauce (which happens to be made of rotten vegetables... see where this is going?).

the flavor is similar after the rotten note blows over... green raspberry tartness, red raspberry fruity goodness, cream cheese, mineral/slate, grass, wood and a lemony tartness. it is complex and not overly tart. 

the palate is sharp and crisp yet there is some grit/chalkiness to the texture. wow! 8/5/8/4/17/4.2

Bottle shared by Sparky27 @ the Black Friday tasting...ERIC ROCKS!!!  Another one I never thought Id get a chance to try.  Golden garnet pour with a white film floating atop the body and a ring circling the glass.  The aroma is pungent raspberry, tart cherry skin, lemon rind, and light barnyard.  This was a really enjoyable sour...not jaw-locking, lip-puckering, or eye-watering...rather drinkable, satisfying, and memorable.  Flavor shows freshly picked, slighly green raspberry, cheese, and balsamic vinegar.  Really tasty and glad to have had a change to sample!!!  THANKS AGAIN ERIC!!!

750 mL bottle, courtesy of  ygtbsm94, dated 2-14-2007. Pours a pinkish red-orange with slight pinkish head. The aroma has a whole lot going on--raspberry, lavender, leather, cheese, oak, cherry (noticeable only after it breathes for a while), brett, lemon, and witch hazel. The flavor is a nice, creamy cheesiness with a very assertive sourness under it. The raspberry is rather evident, but I have to struggle to pick up any cherry. There is plenty of oak and general woodiness, as well as a bit of zesty character. Toward the finish is a nice, farmy brett character and a dry, waxy honeycomb (stole the descriptor from NachlamSie) note that I find rather fascinating. Quite a good beer.

750ml from February 2007 graciously provided by Tronraner. Pours very red, making the use of cherries visually obvious.  This is quite effervescent though without a head. The aroma is boggling my nose with its depth and complexity. I can pick out cherries, fresh wood, sourness, basement, barnyard, cloth. I could probably sniff this all day and not really come to a solid conclusion. The flavor is less sour than I was lead to believe, tough still with a tartness. I find hints at cherry, muscadine, oak, and a lingering honeycomb quality in the finish, oh and cheesecake. This is an impressively made fruit beer with tremendous depth and complexity, though in the end I usually prefer beer without the use of fruit.

Bottle at Novare Res.  Pours a cloudy reddish tan with a little white pinkish head.  Aroma is fruits and leather. Flavor is what this baby brings to the table though.  Its got a initial bite of sweet and sourness from the yeast and fruit and has almost a fig-like flavor in malt backbone.  Not an overwhelming yeast at all though, very mild mannered for a lambic...or maybe ive just had too many :-P  Unlike most raspberry dominated lambics this one has a flavor of overripened fruits rather than unripe ones.  This is a strange and unique one, a must have for sure.

I nearly crapped my pants when Sparky27 busted this out for Black Friday, so huge thanks to Eric!  Pours ruby in color with a pink head -- very pretty for a beer.  Very barnyard -- loaded with the aroma of funky yeast and underripe raspberries.  Tastes aggressively of Worchestire sauce at the front of the palate followed by an almost Kool-Aid-like tart cherry/raspberry flavor on the finish.  Unique and memorable.  Glad to have had this one.

Sample think that sparky 27 was responsible for this one two. Raspberry sour aroma with what seemed to be winter silage aroma from the old cold Wis days. Good raspberry flavor with a sourness to it. Also something in there couldnt quite figure out what it was. So will just call it the funk you guys talk about.
pours a reddish pink white head aroma raspberry kool aid vinegar. flavor is rasp berry medicine wet dog mold acidic sourness lemon funk. good sour.

Bottle dated 14/02/2007, bought at the brewery store in July 2008, consumed on 21/11/2009.
Appearance is bright purple, starts clear and progresses to cloudy/chunky due to my poor pouring skills.  Soda-pop head that starts vigorously but disappears in seconds to leave no bubbles or lacing.
Smell changes every nanosecond.  Vinegar, sour cherries, horse, raspberries, dust, and about a million other things - all at the same time.
Taste was amazing.  Defies words.  Sweet and sour all at once.  Evident fruit.  Must, dust and mold, and sweaty animals.  Vinegar, the high end balsamic type from Modena.
Mouthfeel is orgasmic.
Drinkability is top of the line, not just for lambics, but for all beer.  Nothing short of miraculous.

750...capped. wow. thanks, sprinkle, among others, for sending one out. this is a frickin incredible beer. pours a murky raspberry red with no head or lace. humongous tart raspberry nose. some wood showing. creamy medium body, fairly flat. berries and wood on the mid palate...not insanely complex, but thoroughly delicious. long tart finish.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2009 750ml foiled, corked, caged and dated 2/14/2007; shared by after4ever.  Hazy rose with beautiful lacy small bubbles.  Horse blankets, raspberry, oak, minerals, awesome!  Super effervescent up front with earthy wood, minerals, aspirin, tart berry...so fing good.  Barnyardie funk as well...thanks Tom, I love this!

Hazy, red colour, pinkish small h, fair lace. Sweetish, sour, light bitter, raspberry, woody, tart. Flavourful and balanced. Great stuff!

Pours a deep dark ruby red color with dark mahogany edges and a slightly pinkish one finger fizzy head that quickly fades into a lasting ring and some visible carbonation bubbles.

Barnyard funk aroma that is very earthy with some ashy oaky wood. The raspberries have faded a bit by this point and there is a somewhat scorched earth, moldy musty character. The fruit is there although it seems concentrated and I could swear that I could even smell the seeds.

Extremely tart, sour and funky. Very puckering and lip smacking while only mildly acidic. Lots of sweet dry raspberry buried beneath the barnyard lactic funkiness. As in the aroma, the raspberries have faded but they are still evident. This beer is intensely sour but is somewhat balanced by the sweetness of the berries. There is also some earthy oak and vanilla notes and a very sour puckering dry acidity with some more acidity coming through. The burnt ashy wood character from the aroma comes through a bit.

I cant believe how sour this beer has become with the aging. I wish I could have tried this fresh to see how prominent the berries were. Either way this beer is very complex with lots of delicious flavors bouncing off of one another. I picked something else up with each sip. Im not the biggest fan of raspberry beers or raspberries for that matter but this beer was very impressive. All sour heads should seek this one out.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2009 This was a really nice bright pink color with a tenacious head that was only slightly less colorful. The smell was delicious raspberries with a hint of lambic. The flavor was really outstanding like eating raspberry jam with huge chunks of raspberries. The fruit component was fantastic. i didnt detect much funkiness and it was only slightly tart but overall I was very impressed. This is probably the best fruit lambic I have had if not a close second to Cantillon Fou Foune. Amazing beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-22-2009 01:17:57

BPW #87
Served from a 750 mL bottle dated 2/14/07. Thanks to Andy for sharing this one. Appearance is a rich raspberry red with some dying bubbles. The aromas are sour wild yeasts and creamy raspberry. The oak flavors are mild and nice. They are followed with a solid tart raspberry. Mouth is really full of effervesces. A solid brew that I was glad to get to try.

Dans Bachelor Party Extended Weekend Rating #83 of 90. 2007 Bottle shared with danielcurtis81. Pours cloudy reddish brown, nice dancing carbonation bubbles. Sour raspberries and lambic tart come forward on the nose. Sweet n sour taste hits first followed by good sour raspberries, nice oak undertones and good soft carbonation...plus funk.

75cl bottle from GBBF 2007 and kept for over 2 years, the bottles with no label.  Isnt it so good to have a beer that lives up to the hype?  The aroma is perfect.  So much raspberry fruit, its stunning.  Brilliant clear red orange colour, with disappearing slight pink head.  Raspberry, cherry and a touch of funk.  Lovely in mouth, smooth, bit too carbonated, so I had to do a bit of decanting to get rid of the bubbles, but then this swallow of pippy raspberry and sourness starts and lingers into one of the best finish of a beer Ive had.  So easily a 10 for aroma, a five for appearance.  The flavour amazing, just maybe too much verging on the vinegar.  The sourness is excellent with just that touch of funk.  The finish is unbelievable, but as I say, just that touch of vinegar takes the edge off.

Bottle a WTF OMG tasting.  Pours a cloudy ruby red color topped by a foamy white head that quickly dissipates. The aroma is a mixture of raspberries, strawberries, really funky barnyard notes, and burnt rubber. Something just smells off and really wrong. The flavor follows suit with tart raspberries and strawberries followed by some acidity, heavy funk, and burnt rubber. I dont remember this beer tasting like this. Medium bodied and touch syrupy from all the fruit with ample carbonation and a dry, sour finish. I would like to try this one again to rerate.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2010 RERATE from a bottle at RBWG. Much better this time around. Not an autolysis bomb. Hints of rubber, but nothing bad, cheesy, tart fruits, funk, musty basement, floral notes, lactic sourness. Much better. Very nice beer. -----bottle @ WTF OMG! Nose was huge rubber, michelin, burning, funky as hell, autolysis, apple skin, sour grapes, raspberry, loads of acidity. Flavor was an overwhelming rubber flavor, loads of rediculous funk, cheesy, horsey, the whole 9 yards. The rubber was tough to get past. (3.2)

Green bottle, 75 cl, bottled on 14/02/2007, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!) eye: cherry, clear, minimal effervescence, slightly pink head that disappears completely, no lacing; nose: lots of horse, Brettanomyces yeast, fruity; mouth: lots of horse, sour Brettanomyces yeast, fruity, finale in horse with light fruity presence, rather carbonated, quite sour, lightly sweet and acidic, medium body; overall: ordinary

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille verte, 75 cl, embouteillée le 14/02/2007, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!) il : cerise, claire, effervescence minime, mousse légèrement rosée qui disparaît presque complètement, pas de dentelle; nez : beaucoup de cheval, levure Brettanomyces, fruité; bouche : beaucoup de cheval, aigre, levure Brettanomyces, fruité, finale en cheval avec légère présence de fruité, plutôt carbonatée, très aigre, légèrement sucrée et acide, corps moyen; en résumé : ordinaire

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2009 Bottle shared at Toronado 22nd Anniversary, damn expensive but worth it.  Tart berry aroma with mild sweetness and some funk.  Flavor really incredible and long-lasting, tart yet slightly sweet raspberry and cherry, maybe some other berries, and wood.  Palate awesomely dry and sharp.  An awesome fruit lambic overall, one of the best Ive tried yet.

Bottle thanks to nick for sharing at SDBF09. Red with a hint of brown pour slightly cloudy.  Aroma is of raspberries, and cherries mostly tart but has some sweetness to it. Flavor is well done with a slight oak finish

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2011 750ml bottle shared by MartinT. WOW.
Appearance : Clear red with a small head.

Aroma : Great funk with LOTS of raspberries. Nice notes of sweet cherries. 

Taste : Sharp acidic sourness with great fruity raspberries and cheries. Finish is funky with lots of raspberries. Quite acidic. 

Overall : Wow this is still awesome. I dont think it show any signs of decline. Still lots and lots of raspberries. Maybe a bit more acidic than what I remembered. I still really like the complexity of having both raspberries and cherries. The cherries carry a more sweetish and round profile while the raspberries are all sharp and dry. They really balance each other beautifully. Finish is very persistent with great funk. Nose is still vibrant and very expressive. It still feels like a "young" fruit lambic. Stunning! Total score stays the same. 

750ml bottle thanks to my friend Julien at Delirium Café. Pours red with a small head. Aroma is big raspberry with hints of cherries. Little tart. Taste is tart but not too much. Big cherries and some raspberries. A bit acidic but not much. The keyword here is balance. it really felt as a whole while having the raspberries and the cherries "fighting" for your palate and nose. Really dry finish. A really special brew dranked with great folks. Nice memories there. July 2009. 9,4,9,5,18;4.5

Bottle shared at gears81s wedding, Congratulations Jake!! Pours a beautiful translucent ruby color. Aroma is a  light raspberry and lemon peel. Flavor is soft raspberry flavor with a little tartness but a nice sour finish. Not too funky, but more acidic and fruity. Carbonation is lively and and perfect for the style.

Colore rubino carico,un pò opaco,poco o niente schiuma(lho già notato in altre lambic,devessere tipico del genere).Aroma forte:ciliegie,lamponi,sentori di cantina.In bocca è un pò aspra,astringente e agrumata.Molto dolce si sentono appieno i lamponi.Equilibrata perfettamente.Finale lungo.Che dire daltro? Praticamente la perfezione del genere!
Bottle @ Ölbloggarprovning syd. Ruby color with light pink head. Red berries cherry raspberry sweet and sour nice balance. taste sweet red beeries raspberries sour citrus well balanced.

Bottled. Dark reddish coloured. Unclear. Light reddish head. Raspberries, sweetness, earth and some marcipan in the aroma. Flavour full of earth and raspberries. Acidic touch and sourness with a light sweetish touch. Has some light barnyard notes. Full bodied. Very dry. Sourish fruitsweetness in the end. Very very nice.
Lovely genuine raspberry aroma and even more wondefull flavour, slightly tart, well balanced and extremely fruity. Deep looking, deep tasting and straight up just a pure joy to drink really.

Bottle thanks to Jaxson.  Been looking forward to this one for awhile now.  Poured a beautiful garnet red with a slight pink head on top.  Aroma was funky tart, lots of red berries.  The beer is incredibly inviting.  Taste was funky and acidic, but not over the top, with tart raspberries and cranberries on the finish.  This beer was less acidic than some of the traditional lambic beers I have had.  I thought it was really drinkable and incredibly balanced.

Well another badass beer shared by JW77...hell yeah!!    Pours a wonderful red color.  Small head.  Aroma is funky, fruity, tart and really smells a lot like cranberries and sour cherries.  So drinking this is quite the experience.  It is tart and sour but so fruity.  Tingling in the mouth with tons of fruit and funk.  Dry on the finish.  This isnt cantillon sour, but it is complex and really nice.  Easy to drink.  Thanks Jonathan.

A pricey 750 ml bottle that i have been looking forward to for quite a while.  Well, here we finally go.  Poured into snifter at cellar temp 55F to celebrate rating #500. Upon taking the foil off I can already smell this stuff (cork still in... a synthetic cork too, what the hell is up with that?). Pours a beautiful raspberry ruby red with a slight purple hue and a small pink head that took a bit of aggression to stir up, and which faded pretty quickly to a pink ring. Aroma is very fresh and funky - smells like bitter tart cherries upfront followed by sweet and very enticing fresh raspberries. The typical 3F musty, funky, wild character is there as well, and works great with the fruity aroma.  The flavor lacks the sweetness hinted at in the aroma but is still very pleasant.  Bitter tart raspberries upfront that lend to the funky barnyard character that follows through the moderately dry and acidic finish.  Very well blended.  Not one of the IN-YOUR-FACE lambics, but there is much to appreciate in the subtleties and the freshness of the fruity quality of this one.  Medium bodied with meidum to minimal carbonation, which to me is PERFECT for this style.  Overcarbonation -despite ebing a standard quality for many lambics- is a turn off to me.  Overall: this is a beautifully crafted beer.  At its price, it is worth purchasing to split with someone, but I am not sure I will ever be having this one again unless it comes to me as a gift.  Very glad I invested though to try it at least once. Cheers to 500 more!!

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 750mL Bottle. 02.14.2007. Bottled. 
Cloudy red colour, with small pinkish head. Fresh raspberries dominate the aroma, whereas the acid comes second. Flavourwise, acid is most prominent, with earth and raspberries coming after. Its dry and tart, with a fresh raspberry feel to it. Good sparkling, with surprisingly mellow mouthfeel.

Bottle courtesy of rudolf: Magenta colored body topped by a thin white head. Great aroma that is full of raspberries, dusty earthiness and barnyard notes. Nicely balanced sourness. Bright raspberry flavors with just a touch of sweetness and faint oak flavors. Excellent.

Bottle at Rudolfs Lambic tasting 2009. Pours a ruby red with small white head. Funky, musty aroma with light raspberry fruitiness thrown in. Taste was berry tartness, light funk, juice, acidic, right amount of sourness. Very well done

Bottle from MaltOMeal at the Houston sour tasting.  Thanks, man!  Pours an average muddy, iced tea brown with a nose of body odor and cedar.  Flavor is sour cedar-infused fruit with wooden planks in the finish.  Average mouthfeel.  Refreshing beer.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: [Bottle] from ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad!! Pours a clear deep pink with a small, effervescent pink head. I can smell raspberry jam from about two feet away, and undeniable sharpness that hints at the tart lactic acidity. As it warms, the brett character becomes evident as well. The flavor is absolutely amazing. Loads of juicy raspberries, crazy acidity and tartness, just enough funk, and a touch of dry oakiness. Crazy, crazy delicious, and one that I can see aging really well.

C&C 750 at Monks in Philly, shared with JCB and MrBendo. Bottle dats Feb. 14, 2007. OMG. LOVED IT! Cloudy, dirty red with a pink tinged head. Big raspberry nose, acidic, musty woodiness, some citrusy (lime?) notes. Funky raspberry flavors, tart, cherry finally makes an appearance, woody... just a whole lot going on here! Absolutely delish!

Bottle. What a hell of a tribute.  Pours a pulpy ruby body with an off white lacing.  Cherry pit, and skins.  Very low acidity with a light woodiness, fresh tart raspberries and delicious sour fruit character.  I love this beer!

750 ml bottle from Bieropholie, shared by Ben (thanks), served cold in a goblet. AP24/09.
App.:  Cloudy, very reddish-amber, remnants of an off-white head.
  
Aroma:  A good dose of barnyard funk, light ammonia, light rubber, some nice juicy raspberry and raspberry bush, white pepper, plenty of organic acids, sour cherries, leathery, raspberry seeds.
  
Palate:  Medium-ish body, fairly sparse effervescence, a bit astringent.
  
Flav.:  Lots of tart raspberries, some cherry, quite a bit fruitier than the nose; minerals and funky organic acids, barnyard and leather, bitter green herbs, quite sour and bitter with light funk and mineral-fruit.

A great fruit Lambik Im sure.  Slowly getting used to the style...

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2009 Courtesy of AllAboutStout
Bottle: The aroma consists of musty raspberries, moderate woodiness, and mild tartness.  It pours a transparent reddish-orange and a small pink head.  The flavor starts with a quick sweet raspberries.  The flavor turns to moderately tart raspberry in the finish with some faint woodiness.  The woodiness lingers in the aftertaste.  Light-medium bodied with somewhat lively carbonation.

This is a great 07 bottle thanks to ygtbsm94!  Bright hazy red with orange tinge with thin white head.  Loads of raspberries, very juicy, cherries, oak barrels, barnyard funk, leather, sour, bread, and musty hops.  Complex and tasty.  Not for the faint of heart however.

750ml bottle thanks to ygtbsm94, cheers Brad!  Aroma has notes of cherries, raspberries, leather, and barnyard funk.  Deep medium cherry red hue with a small pink head that nearly diminished and left no lace.  Flavor is sweet and really sour with a short finish.  Palate is medium bodied and lively.  I was no fan of sours but lately its all Ive been craving and this beer is the best Ive had to date.  Very complex and fun with a pucker factor of 10.

March Houston Tasting. Thanks to MaltOMeal for his bottle. Pours a bright red color with no head. Nose of cherries, raspberries and tartness. Flavor is sour, tart cherries. Efferficent and clean...very tasty.

750ml bottle thanks to Sprinkle.  Shared at March Houston Tasting.  Pours a cloudy rose with a thin white head.  Nose of cherries.  Taste is of sour cherries.  Mouthfeel is tart with some pucker factor.  Nice

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2011 750ml bottle consumed August 2007 (?). Pours a luminous dark red with a small white/pink head.  Seriously seedy, fresh, juicy rapsberries in the nose, vibrant, sticky, hugely forward and intense in the aroma.  Musty, sour seedy raspberries, and not just sour from the lambic yeast, but actual sourness from the raspberries, very much an under-ripe, seedy, hugely fruity and juicy.  Amazingly complex, juicy, fruity, tart, sour, everything I want in framboise. (4.2)


2007 750ml bottle consumed March 2009.  Clean first pour reveals cola-like carbonation that fizzles dead quickly on top of a clear and bright ruby red body.  Lactic acid melds exquisitely with the raspberries, but this clean pour seems to lack depth and comes across as plain and subtle.  Subsequent pours with some yeast mixed in reveals significantly more depth in the nose.  Body is spritzy, theres some medicinal notes in there, some aspirin, etc.  Good but not mind-blowing.  Decent balance of lactic acid and acetic acid (resembles Flemish red, actually) which seems to stem from the raspberries themselves.  Nice, but somewhat underwhelming.  Maybe this one truly does need a few more years, but I think its more to do with the base gueuze blend of 3F at the time they made this (look at 2006 and 2007 oude gueuze, its not exactly the best example of the beer theyve made). (3.8)

Bottle from Belmont Station.  Color is a darker pink with a bright cream head - fades fast.  The star of the show is the aroma, which features a moldy berry nasty funk that could just stop a car.  I find both flavor and aroma to be lacking in fruit, which is really only noticeable because of the fruit levels achieved in Schaerbaekse Kriek.

Ruby red brew topped by pink fading head and minimal head. The nose is acidic sour fruits (raspberrty and cherry), oak, hint of brett funk and urine. The taste is more of the same, very sour fruit and light handed funk. The mouth feel is minerally and woody, sprite and lively. It was you expected, nothing more. Seems to be neither funky enough nor earthy enough, perhaps need more age. This bottle is only 1+ year old. No where near the complexity levels of the Scharebeerse Kriek IMO.

Bottle shared with, and courtesy of MartinT. Red tinged brown. Dark super sour aroma. Flavour is dark sour red fruit with a hint of sourness. Sour is not screaming but sinks in and lingers on the tongue.

Red amber of color with a small fast disappering off white head. An nice sour aroma with notes of red berries, raspberries, dry, no hops, no sweets, notes of horse. A flavor of wood, raspberries, sour redberries, horseback, no sweets nor hops, dry and clean taste. NICE!!

750 ml corked and caged bottle poured a clear garnet with a small disapating off white head. Aromas of raspberry, barnyard, leather and oak. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry lightly tart finish. Flavors of raspberry, oak,  barnyard and light leather with a smooth dry lightly tart raspberry finish.

750ml bottle from the Sams in Downers Grove, Illinois:  It pours a slightly hazed ruby body with a brown tint and a modest pink hued head.  It has an aroma of sweaty horse hide, damp wood, and overly ripe (and getting riper) berries and cherries.  A couple of fresh raspberries were dropped into the flavor pool as well as some mild tartness.  The finsih is dry and leaves a funky feeling in the mouth.  Intersting drink that I kindasorta like, but I really dont want to shop in the produce marts of those who found "fresh fruit" in this.  [Insert winking emoticon here.]

Bottle purchased in the Netherlands. Beer poured a clear, deep red color with a slight pink head into my Cantillon glass. The head receeded quickly. The aroma was strong upon popping the cork, vibrant framboise, a bit funky and tart as well. The raspberry taste was lovely and fresh tasting. What you would expect for a true version of the style. Some oaky notes as well. Overall a well rounded and damn fine beer that I wish I had more often but it is to be savored.

Graciously sampled courtesy of the Indy crew, who brought it hard at Footie. 2007 bottle, with a huge vibrant pour, carbonation whipping up the pale pink body and releasing all the wonderfully complex aromas - woody, super dry fruits, champagne. Not much bite to it, as its surprisingly easy drinking. Lovely complexity, the kind of thing you could drink forever.

Bouteille verte, avec bouchon de liège, de 750 ml partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal chez MartinT. Arôme: Légère odeur de vinaigre à la framboise avec très légère pointe de caramel fruité. Apparence: La couleur est rougeâtre voilée. Présence dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de vinaigre aux frambosies. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture huileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement vinaigré. (Rating #2202)

Thanks to the Indy crew for sharing this at the sexual chocolate tasting.  Bright and shiny pink pour with a thin fizzy white head. Dry acidic fruity aroma.  Flavor had hints of wood, raspberries and cherry.  Slightly acidic dry finish

750 bottle thanks to Yves Panneels at In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst. Beautiful light purple color heavily filtered. Nose of fruity raspberries, tart, woody-sharp and distinct. Taste comes off somewhat woody, very tart, with a nice mix of cherries and raspberries. Very light body with nice carbonation-even after 2 years in the bottle. Not an overwhelming fruity taste but the tartness and tanginess and evervescence make this a wonderful drink. Way too easy to put down.  The best of its kind.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
UPDATED: AUG 21, 2012 Update: Re-rate @ RBBSG II.
Reddish brown colour, small white head. Aroma of fruit, cherry, raisins and raspberry pips and old framboise. Brilliant sour flavour, champagne, raspberry, raspberry pips, fresh and fruity. Sour and fruity finish.
If anything, it even gained strenght compared to 4 years ago when I last had it. Good beer and aging well.
(From 75cL bottle @ RBBSG II, Wilrijk. Courtesy of Travlr. Thank you Gene!)

Old rating:
Unfortunately this marvelous beer has not been brewed for a while, but the brewer told he was thinking of making it again
With some friends we shared a bottle at the 3 fonteinen restaurant.
It is a shiny deep red brew with a pretty pinkish head. It has a delightful, fresh fruit aroma, with champagne and some honey.
The taste is beautiful fruit, nice acidity and tartness, reminding of champagne and red wine.
9-4-9-4-18: 4.4

Bottled on Feb 14, 2007 thanks to Yem25. Pours with a lightly pink, creamy head and a very muddy, deep red body with great lacing. Aroma is champagne notes with raspberry, horse hair, vinegar, cherries, pineapple, vanilla, toffee and mustiness. Taste is complex with champagne, raspberries, oats, barnyard, cherries...Complex and clean. Light amount, but tickling bubbles with a dry mouthfeel.

Wow! Bottle shared with bman1113vr. My favorite beer style are lambiks, so this was definitely a treat!
Pours with a redish amber hue, with a small white head that is mostly diminishing. 
I got some citrus, spices, and surprisingly enough some dark fruits in the nose, mainly prunes and dates. Some yeast as well.
Flavor has a syrupy beginning - kind of sweet, but very slight, with a sour ending. The beer overall has a bready/yeasty, champagne flavor to it that is complemented nicely with the fruit notes as well. A very complex taste indeed!
Medium texture with light carbonation!
A great Lambik!!!

750ml bottle.  Bottled Feb 14 2007.  Pours a muddy, bloody pink with a big bubbly rosy head while Im pouring that has no retention whatsoever.  Beautiful color, appearance is completely flat.  Aroma shows awesome signs of funk and fruit.  Total fruit bomb.  Juicy, ripe, intense raspberries.  Wow that it is an amazing fruit aroma.  There is a slight medicinal quality to this, or it could just be a reminder of other Raspberry wine/mead/beers Ive had that were bad or medicinal.  Vanilla and floral notes are also apparent.  Barnyard is pretty subtle, funk is more of a urinal/lemon rind quality.  Taste is very fruity, acidic, dry, tart.  A long, lemony raspberry finish.  This is nice.  I dont think its the best fruit lambic Ive had (that would be belong to Lou Pepe Kriek) but its above most of its class.

first sampled at rbesg07 grand tasting, then a bottle courtesy of duff, shared with betty. bright pink coloured with an off-pink head which died quickly. aroma of grapefruit rind, swimming pool and jerking off in a cherry orchard, some sherbet and cherry ripe flavours with hints of apple raspberry flavoured cottees cordial and masking tape. the sourness is balanced but still vigorous, beautiful stuff

Solid brew, but I had such high expectations.  Pours pink/red with a white head.  Aroma of cherries, raspberries, oak, and the usual funk.  Sour and tart while still being balanced.  Finishes dry and still has the bite.  For the cost of the bottle though, I don’t know if I am going to go back.
Candied raspberries swirl with hints of funkiness and spices in the aroma.  Medium tart flavor has great fruit with just enough wild elements to really make it an interesting brew.  Excellent.

Pours candy pink, with pinkish-white cloudy big head. Smells funky, alcohol though low, penetrates the nose.  Great mouthfeel, raspberries lambic bullseyes the style.  Satisfying aftertaste.  Oh so drinkable.

750ml bottle.  Bright, pink-red colour with a medium white head that vanishes quickly-this looks like desert in a glass.  Intense fresh red raspberry aroma with notes of sour cherries, barnyard, and a nice hint of oak.  The flavor of this beer is a tour de force of balance and intensity: sweet red raspberries, sour cherries, and barnyard funk.  The finish is sour and well controlled, leaving a pleasant sour cherry aftertaste that complements the initial sweetness.   I would love to try this again after a couple of years in the cellar.  A world class beer!

750 ml bottle purchased in May at Capones outside of Philly. Pour is mostly clear ruby, red brown with a pinkish white 1 inch head that falls really fast. Aroma of acidic waxiness, barnyardy yeastiness, and some raspberry fruitiness. Taste is tart and sour, very acidic. Calms down after the initial taste, revealing raspberry fruit and some menthol.  Palate is medium, though a bit slick - coats the mouth nicely. Drying yeasty finish.  Balances out nicely, while still maintaining a sharp sour bite.

Bottle @ LCRBM 08: Poured a pinkish red with a pink-white head. The aroma was sour fruit of cherries and raspberries. The taste was soft sour fruit with a bit acid and malt. I’m not at all a lambic fan, but I am sure I could have drank a whole bottle of this!
Pours out redish with huge pink head, which rapidly dimnished. Smells fruity. Taste is tart with the raspberries shining through. Great sour finish. Funky and dry with a little acid.

Bottle, Many thanks to Cgarvieuk aka Craig forgiving me this beer   Pours the colour of a sightly watered down blood topped off by a rapidly dimnishing pink head. Sour and tart aroma with berries noticeable, Loz picked out the cherries as well I’m afraid I couldn’t detect them. Refreshing zippy tartness in the mouth lovely sourness, nice carbonation, at times the sweetness that comes through (only a little) tastes a little strawberry like. Nice softness round the edges to this, I’m drinking a 750ml bottle to myself and its quite moreish.

Bottle: (Thanks ygtbsm94!) Pours a deep hazy red with a pinkish head. The aroma is both fruity and funky/sweet and tart with tart raspberry, sweeter notes of cherry (almond-like) notes along with a crisp earthy acidity, barnyard/horse blanket, brie cheese funk and leather. Has a medium acidity on the palate. Flavor is very tart/almost sour. Acidic raspberry skin character is evident, followed by a subtle sweet note from the cherry which is marzipan-like. Then lots of funk come out with cork, leather, mild salty notes, barnyard and residual acetic flavors. Has a mineral-y note into the bone dry finish. Very well integrated fruit notes; this is great stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2008 What a fantastic beer. Picked this up as a special occassion beer, and it didnt let me down!  Pours a murky reddish purple, with a pencil thin ring of lacing . Aroma is sour , sour, sour, and full of funk.  The rasberries really penetrate and fill the nostrils, while the cherries add lots of character.  Flavor is very tart and sour, with a big fruity punch. Lots of raspberry, but it never becomes overly sweet or sticky. Some straw, funk,  and yeast in the background. Some hay-type notes in the background.  Very sour on the palate. The funk, sourness, and fruit come together almost perfectly. This is an excellent beer...but, in its current form, it just doesnt justify the price tag, when theres some other almost-as-good lambic out there for half the price.  However, this one should age amazingly.

Hedonically nearly perfect. The aroma is perfectly balanced between real fresh fruit, and framboise. By this I mean the raspberry is so real it transcends the lambicness at times, then just melds with it. A stony, pitty aroma presence, minerally at times, runs around in waves. The color is incredibly gorgeous, with the hints of tan increasing thoughts of leather in the horse barn. Flavors are somewhat acetic, somewhat lactic, sweet and sour and leathery. Incredible back of the throat sourness. Palate lets down just the tiniest bit; first brawny and slippery and thick, then with the feeling of a slight watery hole. A truly great beer. Thanks John.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text:
UPDATED: OCT 31, 2008 Bottle at EBF08. Good citric fruit, berry aroma. Deep red colour. The flavour is citric but mild, rounded off by the fruit. Very nice. 9 3 9 4 19

Bottle at LCRBM08. Good citric aroma. Good citric flavour, some fruit. Cloudy dark red colour. Hint of funk, but still good. Very citric. 8 3 8 3 18

Deep red in colour with just a bit of brown thrown in, very thin white coloured head that left no lacing.  The aroma is of light cherries, lots of tart raspberries, lightly acidic, some oak, sour.  The flavour is very tart to start, dries out then gets a bit sweet, lots of tart raspberries throughout this, sour, some grapes.  Tart mouthfeel, medium body, medium/high carbonation.  Finishes long with some sweetness but then the tart raspberries take over.
A wonderful fruit lambic.  Great sourness and tartness throughout this.  I see this one aging very well.
750ml bottle obtained in a trade with henrikb, thanks Henrik.
Opened on March 25, 2008.
Bottled February 14, 2007.

(750ml) Thanks to MartinT for sharing this treasure. Pours a medium white head with a brown-red body. Nose is earth, seed, green leaf and tart raspberry. Flavour is nicely soured, limes and raspberry. Lasting tart finish.

my favorite sour with rasberries...bottle shared on the rbsg bus...by me!
sour funky rasberry nose...and tons of complex tart fruit flavors

750ml bottle purchased at Ebenezer’s. Poured a bright reddish amber in color with a small pink head. Aroma is very tart with berries, brett, oak, and funky. Taste is extremely tart. Flavors of sour cherries, raspberries, oak, barnyard funk. Finish is dry, and very nice. I really enjoyed this one.

750ml, thanks cmubeerman - dated Feb., 14th, 2007.  Cloudy pink color with a pinkish head.  Aroma is awesome.  Super sour and tart, light berry notes, musty, woody, wet hay/wool.  Flavor of sweet tarts and sour cherries and raspberries.  Finish is almost painful and lemony.  Light drinking and superb.

Bottle (750ml).  Shared with blankboy and garthicus, my bottle thanks to the amazing generosity of Glouglouburp!.  Cloudy deep ruby pour with an average-sized frothy head and thick strands of lacing (I drooled looking at it, that’s a 5!).  Yummy aroma - look, I don’t have the words to adequately describe this beer, so:  sour-lemon-heavy yeast-burnt rubber-sour green fruit ....  you know;  GOOD!  The taste followed right on - more fruit, more funk, dry, pungent, sour - I wanted to just drink it all myself, such a great Lambic.  Thick bodied, hugely acidic but still the fruit character held its own - one of the best fruit sours I’ve ever had.  Thanks again, Dany!

Bottle (750ml) shared with HogTownHarry & garthicus -- courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pours a lovely cherry red with an average size pinkish-white head. Aroma: Oh yeah! Sweet malt, funky yeast, tart raspberries, light spices, oak and light hops -- just awesome. Flavour follows the aroma -- well balanced tart-ey goodness! Medium bodied. Fantastic stuff, a great example of the style. Thanks for sharing Harry!

[1461-20080531] 750mL bottle. Tart raspberry aroma has lots of wood barrel sourness. Murky, dark red brown body with a medium-lasting foamy light pink head. Sour cherry flavour has some raspberry tartness a bit of pleasant dry acidity. Medium body is sour. Wonderful beverage, lovely balance, perfect state of sourness.
(Post-Mondial Tasting)

Bottle while in San Diego on 08/01/2008 for the RBSG Friday Pub Crawl. Slightly hazy red body with a small pink head. Sour, cherry aroma with some funk aroma. Very sour cherry flavor, hints of raspberry. Medium light body with moderately high carbonation.

thanks andrew. plum inside color.  white head rim.  nice. smells better than it tastes.  smells really funky.  like portabellas.  nose changes a lot as you sit there, gets better, sweeter.  it’s pretty drinkable and balanced.  nick thinks it’s the most amazing beer ever.  i don’t quite get more than 1 dimension, but i can’t ever with this style.
Pours red with a small pink head. Aroma is funky, woody, and raspberry. Very nice flavor, sweet tart and sour all balanced nicely.

750 mL bottle purchased at Liquor Max in Loveland, CO.  Pours hazy ruby with an average, fizzy, off-white (ruby) head, mostly diminishing with spare lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, hay, straw), average hops (flowers, grass), heavy yeast (horse blanket, barnyard) with notes of raspberry.  Light bodied, sticky texture, lively carbonation, and a bitter finish.  Long duration, light sweetness, heavy acidity and bitterness.

On the RBSG 2008 bus - also served by Dr. Bill (if I remember correctly). Pours cloudy dark amber reddish pinkish brown with a white head. Nice tart, berry-like funky/horsey nose. Whoah, pretty damn puckering sour - notes of lemon, citric acidity, berries, strawberry and no shortage of brett funkiness. Very well-attenuated, light bodied with moderate carbonation. Very good.

At RBSG, one of the earliest tasted, and I’m glad of that because I still remember it well! Beautiful bright pink pour with no head. Nose and flavor were tart cherries and raspberries that finished smoothly with toasted almond and oak dryness. A real treat!
From a bottle shared at the Grand Tasting during RBSG 2008 in San Diego. Lots of sour cherries in the aromas and sweet sourness in the flavor. An excellent lambic, one of my favorite of the day.
Tasted at the RBSG.  Pink red with no head.  Sweet fruit, raspberries, apple, and cherry sourness.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2009 8/2/08:  aroma was fantastically funky and fruity...color was blood orange and hazy.  flavors were grittily fruity but not sour or funky enough.  carbonation on the low side.  good shit though, but could be spritzier and funkier in flavor. 10.5.8.4.16

Re-Rate: 12/13/09:  Nose is just outrageously funky..loads of bandage, stepped on raspberries, vanilla, Flavors this time had a lot of the funky bandage notes that apparently the first bottle did not have.  Lots of wood and vanilla..but funky too.  This really has a unique funky character with sweet soft vanilla bringing above what youd expect.

HogTownHarrys bottle, shared with great gusto with Harry and Blankboy. App: Cherry red, zero head, no visible carbonation. Aroma: SEXY! In fact, I had to censor this rating a little as I got a bit excited (I referred to hookers turned into ladies a la ’Pretty Woman’) Anyhow: Flavour: Sour cherry, bitter and sweet, like drinking a cherry cola whilst on LSD - simply superb.
This red lambic ale poured with a thin pink head and a fruity floral aroma. There is a sharp raspberry flavor that is both tart and mellow - very dry.

Bottle shared with Marcus and Steve at Toronado. Reddish/mahogany color with a minimal pinkish head. A nice sour aroma. Hard to pick up any raspbery. Near medium body with mild carbonation. It is smooth oaky sour. The raspberries are not overwhelming. It brings kalamata olives to mind. Astringent, woody and dry. But some sort of sour sugar hits the sides of the mouth in the finish.

Beautiful dark red body with a light pink head. The aroma is massive raspberries with some hay. There are also some leathery notes. The taste is very tart with some light raspberries behind it. There is also some leathery goodness behind that. A light clean body, this is not as overwhelming as I would have expected. Very nicely made with a dry finish.

Pours ruby red with an light red head bubbly head that dissapates quickly.  Aroma of barnyard, wood, cherries, and raspberries.  Taste is wood to start with the cherry and raspberry showing up in the middle with a nice tart ending.  What a great balanced mix of flavors without anything overpowering the other.  Thanks Grim!!!

Bottle shared by my son Enniskillen from Bottleworks; Nose is horseblanket and sour cherries cloudy raspberry colored with a nice pink head; flavor is very tart with nice cherries; nicely funky without completely overshadowing the cherries; excellently balanced!

Red with a thin white head.  Aroma is sour, vinegar, raspberries, cherries.  Taste is a light red wine vinegar like character, raspberries, and cherries show with light funkiness, lightly acidic.  Real nice stuff.
750 ml bottle.  Lots of sour funk in this beer.  Flavors and aromas of cherry.  Very tasty.  Acidic in the finish with more sour and tartness to tickle the palate.  Good Stuff

Orange/red color with a fleeting white head. Huge seedy woody aroma with barnyard and fresh raspberries. Light/medium body. Flavor starts dry and tart with raspberry seed, wood with citrusy lemon and dry hay; nicely complex with a fairly strong acididty throughout. Another fantastic 3 Fonts brew. As for the big price, im just glad to have had the chance to try this without jetting to Belgium or giving up half my cellar stash....
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Like a sweet Rapsberry Jam. For a Lambic, not much tartness or funk at all, which is nice for a cjange. Damn good beer, but a bit pricey for sure.

"The Funk Runs Deep" was the quote put forth to describe this beer. 

Nicely tart, but the action really came through on the funky character of this beer. Really nice. Great composition of fruit lustrous aromas and Thanks to DA for dropping some cash and bringing it to share. Defiantly worth sharing at a tasting.

Bottle at Spuyten Duyvil. Wow! Gorgeous earthy red pour. Aroma luscious lambic juice, wheat, sour raspberry, strawberry, cherry, earth, funk, but all in glorious, full-flavor, full-body balance. Flavor, well, what more can I say after the aroma but that it all just continues in wonderful harmony. A lambic thats at once splendidly tart, flooringly fruity, and superbly refreshing. My note-taking skills may have eroded over the course of many hours in 95 degree heat, but this one was a thing of beauty.

Bottle from Spuyten Duyvil.  I was super excited to get to try this beer!  Pours a dark red/pink with a beautiful light pink head.  Aroma of oak, raspberry, and tartness.  Flavor of sweet raspberries, tartness, sugar.  Initially this was very sweet but got more sour as I drank it.  Quite delicious but it doesnt beat Schaerbeekse for me.

Capones, 750ml bottle. Aroma is like a hop full of berries with raspberry being prominent. The appearance is mix of amber and orange with no head. Flavor is tart like a bottle of pure cherry juice. Tart puckering start with a bubbly sour finish. Very tart and dry, hard to find the fruit with the tart and sour.

750 ml bottle from Capones.  Served in a flute.  Pours copper amber orange with not much heat at all.  The nose smells like raspberry jam with some cherry pits and stems.  The lambic character takes over any impression of fruit that may be here.  Sure I get a bit, but it is very tart and lactic yogurt flavored.  Medium body with high carbonation.  Very dry finish.  Not really one of my favorite lamics, but still tasty.
Bottle at Spuyten Brettfest. Ruby red color with a beautiful, funkified aroma. Dry without being sweet, tart and somewhat puckering, cheesy and leathery. All good stuff in this.

0,75 l bottle, at Hopheads tasting at Roger´s place. Reddishbrown color, moderate white head. Aroma is fruity (berries) and some sourness. Flavor is sweet berries, lovely sourness, wood. Wonderful aftertaste. Very complexe and balanced lambic.

2008-05-31. hazy red body, modest white-pink head. (3+) Light musty funk introduces a good amount of rich raspberry aroma. (8+) Flavour is cheek tuggingly sour at first but the tongue quickly acclimatizes, remains quite sour throughout but allows the fruit to come out nicely. Tart-sour raspberries. (7+) Palate is zippy, average plus body - its not superb for my own preferences, but it is spot on for the beer. Pretty awesome, many thanks to those who brought this, it was one of my few must tries that I did not find on my trip to Belgium. Quite good. Bottle, Post-Mondial Tasting, Montreal
Bottle from Miketd, thanks.  Pours a deep pink with no head.  Aroma of tart raspberries, cherries.  Flavors of the same.

5-24-08 bottle shared by Miketd - thanks! 
Red grapefruit in color with a quickly fading pastel pink head.  Smell is a hint funky with a touch of ammonia in there with a hefty amount of fruit.   Very tart flavor of berries and cherries.  Nice, enjoyable and sour.  Palate is fitting and not too thin.  Overall, a good brew and an enjoyable fruity beer.

750ml Bottle:  Sour, acidic aroma of raspberries, and a little bit of chemicals.  Poured dark red (raspberry red or blood red) in color with a medium-sized pink head that diminished rather quickly.  Opaque.  Cloudy.  Flavor is medium sweet, lightly sour, and very acidic.  Tastes of raspberries, oak, and a little bit of cherries.  Medium body.  Tingly texture.  Lively carbonation.  Raspberry and acid finish.  Good, but not sure why it cost me $38 for the bottle.

Bottle shared by the legendary miketd.  Thanks man!!
Pours a dense cranberry color with a very light thin head.  Smell is funky, tart, cherries, and oak.  Flavor is lightly funky, tart cherries and vinegar with a medium body.  I got more cherry than raspberry from it.  Pretty good and nicely sour.

Bottle. Rich reddish-purple beer with an off-white head. Dusty, raspberry, earthy, tart aroma. Tart, raspberry, duty flavor that turns sour. Medium body. Lingering earthy notes with raspberry and a nice sourness. Great complexity and very refreshing.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2009 Bottle shared by miketd at lb4lbs tasting.  Poured a deep pink color with a thin, fizzy pink head.  Aroma of tart, sour cherries and some berry, but not in the most appealing way.  Some yeast also.  Flavor is pretty tart with strong flavors of raspberry and sour cherry, some barnyard funk, and a light yeastiness on the finish.  Crisp and moderately dry.  Pretty nice beer.

Bottle at tasting at Chris Fischers (from Liars Club) house. Pours with a ruby red body topped by a medium thick to thick head with some lacing.  Its tart and sour with a nice funk and notes of raspberry. Light bodied, crisp and smooth.

Pours red/amber with a soft pink head. Tart raspberry and dose of funk to the aroma. Darn, there was a great quote tonight about the funk in this, but I cant quite remember it. The berry flavor was very fresh, like a not quite rip raspberry, sort of tart and very mildly sour. Not very acidic, but a good dry earthiness.

75 cl . Yesterday @ Opstal.
Raspberry red color, with a  little off-white head. 
Aroma fruity, malts. 
medium body.
Taste bit sweet, sour, almost perfect, fruits, malts.

Bottled on 2/14/2007.  Thanks Matt!  The beer pours to a deep ruby garnet body with a super rapid dissipating head.  The aroma is really complex with a raspberry puree and leather mixed with sour yeasts.  Light sugary candy and some cherry juice.  The flavor is leathery puckery cherry and raspberry juice with interesting barnyard components.  The palate is really nice.  Not overly tart or acidic but perfectly balanced between the two.  Nice texture in the mouthfeel and perfect carbonation.

2/14/207 Bottle shared by Matt.  No head and very little carbonation.  Funky raspberries and sharp acetic acid in the nose.  Light acidic barn / raspberry flavor.  Sour but there wasnt a good complexity to the beer.

Bottle (Feb 07 bottling).

Head is initially small, fizzy, pink, fully diminishing.
Body is hazy medium reddish-purple, bottle conditioned.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately yeasty (horseblanket, barnyard, cobwebs), with notes of raspberry and cherry, light notes of band-aid, sour apple, and wood.

Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately to heavily acidic.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, moderately to heavily acidic, lightly bitter.

Medium body, watery/syrupy texture, lively/soft carbonation.

I rarely say this, but thats because I rarely believe its true: this will probably benefit greatly from another couple of years in the bottle.  Although the aroma is very enticing and vibrant, its pretty fruit-forward right now, as with young wine (and priced like the latter as well, at least in the States...$35 a bottle here in Colorado).  I would also ideally want a smidge less sweetness and a smidge more tartness. These are nits...its great stuff as-is to be sure.  And given a few years for the fruits to fade a bit and some aged characters to take their place, I have little doubt that it will gain more depth and breadth.

25 oz bottle, via papsoe I think.  Pours a ruddy red body with a minimal head that vanished quickly.  Nice funky nose with lots of cherry skins and pits, and ripe raspberries.  Light brett, and lots of funky musty cellar notes.  Lots of fresh ripe raspberry and cellar funkiness with zero residual sugars.  Tart, but not overpoweringly sour, I think that there is some room for development in that area.  The mouthfeel is dry and crisp with a nice lingering tart finish.  Overall, quite good, I look forward to the chance to sit down with a whole bottle of this and really get to know it.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2008 750ml bottle thanks to my man Dough77..... oured a pomegranate raspberry red with a thin and quickly disappearing off-white head.  not sure why i gave it a 3 but thats what my notes say..... aroma of light cheese accented by red fruit.  an abundance of raspberried filled the air.... a sharp, crisp raspberry/cherry flavors run wild and intermingled well with the funky cheesiness that provided that nice quality that i like in a lambic.....i hope to try this again one of these days.

Deep magenta color.  Rich fruit flavor, its nice to taste an authentic raspberry fruit flavor.  I havent felt like Ive had a good raspberry lambic in awhile, even with rose and oud beersel framboise.  I dont love this beer, but its a nice lambic style.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2009 Bottle pops open with a bang.  Pours murky red/copper, when held to the light reveals itself an absolute blood red, hazy, fizzy, nice small lacing.  Big sour nose with earth, must, grass, raspberries, pomegranites, cherries, lemons.  Flavor is an impressive montage, first of a noble geuze, hay, lemons, grass, soil, giving rise to elegant assortments of fresh raspberries, sour cherries, pomegranite, and lemon rind.  Acidity is pretty high, sometimes too much so.  Otherwise, a really impressive framboise, soft, fruity, and complex.

Bottle sampled with Mad_indian. Pours deep hazy red with a huge pink head. Aroma of raspberries, yeast, hay, vinegar, and tart. The flavor is definitely tart, raspberry, wood, hay, funky yeast, with a bitter tingle on your tongue for a finish. Good body. Damn good lambic.

Bottle gift from Stegosaurus. Ok, I cant stand lambics I dont want to harshly judge it but its not for me. Murky red pink pour with an overly sweet/ vinegar aroma. Extremely sour to taste. I did not enjoy this that much but I will not trash it just because I do not like the style.
RE-RATE 
Ok the more I drank the bottle and my palate got used to it the more I liked it.

Pours hazy deep magenta (not ruby) with pink head.  Nose is nice; freshly picked raspberries, oaky woody notes, funky yeasty notes, and some root cellary hints.  Tastes tart, but well balanced, and not a mouth puckering tartness.  The tartness here seems to go with the raspberries, making it much more tolerable and less harsh than some lambics Ive had.  The raspberries taste natural (as they should), and this one is very good from start to finish.

Bottle shared by sliffy. Deep ruby pour with a white film. Aroma of funk, wood, sour vinous fruits, and barnyard. Flavors were sour/tart berries, oak, pale malt, and funk. Light body, sour/tart/woody with a woody/sour finish. Nice stuff!

Hazy red coloured beer, very little carbonation and an average white head. Fruity, raspberry aroma with some light sour touches. Full palate. Finish is sour fruity, again that typical raspberry touch with some fruitstone hints. Very nice.
hazy red coloured body with a little white head a sourig fruity aroma a sourig fruity taste with a sourig fruity bitter finich

Its incredible what 10 months has done to this beer. Extreme initial tartness has mellowed to reveal an amazing drink, an outstanding aperitif of sumptious fruit. 75 cL bottle pours a deep maroon-red, pinkish-white head fades fast. Huge nose of raspberry--real, fresh raspberry--with notes of lemon and bits of old goat cheese (wish I had some to pair). Incredibly juicy flavor, Intense but reasonable fruity tartness, with a wave of dryness bubbling out of the champagne-like mouthfeel. That real fruit reigns throughout.

Bottle  Muddy, pink/red body (lots of pieces of raspberry).  Head disappears fastly.  Aroma is full of raspberry with some wood.  Lightly bitter, heavily sour initial flavour.  Moderately sour finish.  Quite nice with an ok complexity.
Thanks to Jason for this one.  Cloudy red color.  Aroma is a sour raspberry fruit, much like yogurt and cheese.  Flavor is a sweet sour fruity mix.  Body is medium and plentiful.

Aroma:  medicine, Band-aids, sourness, and fruits

Appearance:  reddish-purple, small head, little lacing

Flavor:  sourness, seedy raspberries, tart cherries, stems, leaves, hairs, juices, cherry pits

Palate:  smooth with tart bite, seedy fruity aftertaste

UPDATED: APR 13, 2008 Courtesy of kramer17801. Cloudy, hazy ruby red body with a small beige head with a slight pink tint. Sour pie cherry nose with cheese, lactic acid, light berry and horseblanket. The flavor is lightly sweet, moderately sour with an enormous amount of sour pie cherries, lots of raspberry, some yogurt, cheese, melon and lemon. Medium body is soft with moderate carbonation. Finish is very long with a lasting pithiness.

On Bottle lot number 14/2/2007 so 1 year old. Very nice and not too sweet. A little sour but still splendid. This is a perfect good fruit beer. No sirup. And with reel lambic it is a very good combination. I love it

A careful pour into my 25cl tulip glass produces a two-finger thick, faintly pink tinged, off-white colored head.  The beer is a deep red hue that shows a stunningly, brilliantly clear, bright red color that has touches of gold to it when held up to the light.  The aroma smells of raspberry pits as I pour it and a deeper inspecting yields sweet raspberry flesh followed by medicinal phenolics, a touch of plastic notes and just a big Brettanomyces presence.  The finish is quite phenolic all in all, but serves as a balancing note to the up front expressive fruit and light lactic tartness. 

Quite dry tasting, which is quite different than young bottles, with a solid lactic tartness, a woody raspberry pit note, sour raspberry flesh and a medicinal / phenolic finish that doesnt come on quite as strong as it did in the nose.  The body is quite creamy; perhaps even a touch slick, with a fullness that plays quite well with the other senses.  This still has quite a chewy raspberry flavor to it, but now that it has dried out it is much more woody, more tannic seeming and has that green, almost vegetal quality that all dry, heavily fruited raspberry beers always get.  I should mention that there is still some sweetness to this beer, it is well on its way towards drying out, but this will dry out even further over the coming years.

I will say that this still has quite a few years of life yet.  It will also likely get better than it currently is; it should dry out a bit more, with much of the phenolics being changed and softened with time and perhaps other funky notes coming to the fore.  This is still quite good, but I think I liked this better when it was fresh.  There isnt enough developed funk and complexity in this right now to offset the loss of the fresh raspberry component that this had when young; I still have high hopes for this improving quite a bit over the next couple years though.  So, in the end this is a bit simplistic to be a world class Lambic (at least this particular snapshot), though visually and texturally this is currently just about perfect.
